Title: Data Scientist - Gen AI
Description:
Data Scientist - Gen AI

2 year contract

2 days a week on site




A leading financial services company based in Brussels is seeking a skilled Data Scientist with expertise in Generative AI. You will work in a dynamic and collaborative environment, applying your analytical and technical skills to solve internal business challenges. You will help identify impactful use cases, developing AI-driven solutions, and contributing to the evolution of internal GenAI capabilities and best practices.




Skills Required




5–8 years of experience in data science
Fluent in French or Dutch
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions
Expertise in data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning
Proficiency in Python and libraries such as Pandas & NumPy
Cloud platform experience, particularly with Azure
Deep knowledge of LLM libraries like Langchain, LangGraph
Experience deploying and monitoring GenAI models




Contact Adam Morgan for more information

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a talented and passionate Data Scientist to join our client team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for extracting valuable insights from complex datasets, building predictive models, and contributing to data-driven decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve challenging business problems and drive innovation.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models using Python libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for analysis.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns and trends in data.
Visualize data using libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn to communicate findings effectively.
Collaborate with engineers and product managers to deploy and monitor machine learning models.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, etc.).
Experience with machine learning algorithms and techniques (regression, classification, clustering, etc.).
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methods.
Experience with data visualization tools and libraries.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with SQL and databases.
Experience with Cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Big Data technologies like Spark or Hadoop.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with natural language processing (NLP).
Experience with time series analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.




Other information:

Location: Hungary or Bulgaria

Work Mode: 100% Remote

Contract type: B2B/Freelance

Contract: 6 months (Possibility of extension)

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Trilations is een open-minded, no-nonsense consultancy organisatie. Wij geloven sterk in langdurig engagement, met zowel onze klanten als onze medewerkers. Wij investeren in het delen van kennis, levenslang leren en coaching en bouwen voort op onze pragmatische cultuur, die is gebaseerd op vertrouwen, professionaliteit, integriteit en betrokkenheid.


De consultants van Trilations onderscheiden zich door hun expertise en hun professionele en klantgerichte, vriendelijke houding. Momenteel zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist.


Functieomschrijving

De klanten van Trilations zijn Business Insights verantwoordelijken en hun team binnen toonaangevende bedrijven in de pharma sector zowel in het binnen- als buitenland (EU, LATAM, Americas and Asia). Onze consultants werken nauw samen met het team van de klant en ondersteun het team in het vertalen van hun business-uitdaging naar concrete projecten, het opzetten en uitvoeren van het analyse plan en finaal het delen van de nieuw bekomen inzichten.


In je rol als data scientist werk je nauw samen met zowel het intern project team van Trilations als het team van de klant. Je ondersteunt onze consultants in het aanleveren van waardevolle inzichten die je haalt uit analyses van omvangrijke kwantitatieve & kwalitatieve datasets afkomstig van klanten of eigen marktonderzoek. Het resultaat van je analyses helpt de klant om in te zetten op verbeteringen die het meeste ROI opleveren.


Om deze inzichten te bekomen ga je concreet aan de slag met:

  • Statistische technieken zoals regressie, factor analyse, clustering, etc
  • Machine learning technieken zoals SVM, random forests,...
  • Large language models om inzichten te verwerven uit teksten


Je werkt mee aan de innovatie van Trilations door het ontwikkelen van nieuwe services obv data.


Profiel

  • Je hebt een masterdiploma in een kwantitatieve richting (Wiskunde, Statistics, Data Science, AI, IT, Ingenieurswetenschappen, Experimentele Psychologie,...). Een doctoraatservaring wordt ook in overweging genomen;
  • Je hebt bij voorkeur een minimum van 3 jaar ervaring in een rol als scientist of analyst;
  • Je hebt een grondige kennis van Python (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn,...) en SQL;
  • Ervaring met LLMs en LangChain is een grote troef;
  • Kennis van SPSS is een plus;
  • Je analytische geest en flexibiliteit zijn belangrijk voor het uitvoeren van je job. Je hebt ook ervaring met het beheren en interpreteren van datasets voor het leveren van bruikbare inzichten;
  • Je hebt een proactieve houding en bent in staat om zelfstandig projecten te beheren en effectief samen te werken met diverse teams binnen een organisatie;
  • Je bent gepassioneerd door data en werkt zeer graag in een team;
  • Je beschikt over een grote interesse in de lifesciences sector en hebt ambitie om te groeien. Ervaring en/of kennis in de pharma sector is een pluspunt.


Aanbod

  • Je krijgt een boeiende en gevarieerde functie die je de mogelijkheid biedt je expertise en vaardigheden verder uit te bouwen in een dynamisch team;
  • De mogelijkheid om voor toonaangevende bedrijven te werken, zowel nationaal als internationaal;
  • Een aantrekkelijk salaris met extralegale voordelen, 32 vakantiedagen en een firmawagen of mobiliteitsbudget;
  • Een persoonlijk groeitraject in functie van je mogelijkheden en ambities.


We zijn #ONETEAM

Bij Trilations streven we naar gelijke kansen in ons rekruteringsproces, vrij van vooroordelen of discriminatie op basis van (maar niet beperkt tot) ras, kleur, religie, geslacht, genderidentiteit, seksuele geaardheid, nationaliteit, genetica, beperking of leeftijd. We creëren een bedrijfscultuur waarin iedereen zich gerespecteerd, gewaardeerd en ondersteund voelt. Zowel binnen als buiten ons bedrijf zetten we ons in voor een omgeving zonder discriminatie, waarin iedereen zichzelf kan zijn.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimize rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.







What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?


Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimize rebates, and drive better value.


As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.


We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.


At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.


Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.


Your main responsibilities:

  • Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
  • Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
  • Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
  • Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
  • Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.


Who you are:

  • Machine learning and NLP expertise:
  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
  • Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
  • Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
  • Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.



What we offer:

  • Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
  • Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
  • The possibility to work flexibly.
  • Become part of a team of international high performers.
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
  • Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
afarax is looking for a freelance AI Data Scientist. We need you!




The project:

Our client in the insurance sector is looking for an AI Data Scientist to join their team.




Responsibilities:

Work closely with the business and technical teams to identify high-impact use cases for Generative AI
Design, develop and implement AI driven solutions for business needs, using both internal and external data sources
Identify and communicate insights from data analysis to support decision-making and problem-solving activities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data-related issues
Continuously monitor AI models for accuracy, and proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies and drift
Contribute to the development of a GenAI capability framework and internal best practices




Is this you?

Master’s degree in a quantitative field or a related field with a strong focus on data analysis
Good knowledge of English, French and Dutch
Data science, preferably in a business setting
Strong business acumen and the ability to understand and communicate, business needs and requirements
Proven experience with data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.
Proficient in Python and commonly used libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit learn, etc.).
Cloud Expertise: Strong knowledge of cloud platforms, especially Azure (Azure AI services, Azure ML, Vertex AI, Databricks, Azure OpenAI, etc.)
LLM Libraries: Deep expertise with Python libraries such as Langchain, LangGraph, Promptflow, Semantic Kernel, and Autogen.
Deep understanding of LLMs fine tuning and/or training lifecycle (LLMops).
Gen AI Deployment: Proven experience in deploying and monitoring Gen AI models using CI/CD pipelines, Weight & Biases, and GitHub workflows.
Strong knowledge of data analysis techniques and tools, such as Python, SQL, PBI, DataBricks
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Manage multiple priorities
Meet tight deadlines
Availability for occasional travel and projects in other operating companies




How afarax supports you?

You benefit from our extensive network
You will have access to projects that fit your expertise
We help and support you throughout your project
We offer the possibility to build a valuable and lasting partnership

Check out more projects on: https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Jouw rol is het analyseren en interpreteren van complexe datasets met behulp van AI en machine learning technieken, en deze om te zetten in technische oplossingen om op die manier het gewenste eindresultaat voor de klant te produceren.

Je analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten te ontdekken.

Je ontwikkelt en implementeert machine learning modellen om voorspellingen te doen of beslissingen te automatiseren.

Je neemt ook deel in de ontwikkeling van nieuwe machine learning modellen en prototypes en evalueert deze met de data analisten.

Je communiceert bevindingen en aanbevelingen aan belanghebbenden, vaak door middel van visualisaties en presentaties.




Skills

Je bent pas afgestudeerd of hebt al ervaring, en beschikt over een masterdiploma in IT, Science (zoals wiskunde of fysica), of bent burgerlijk of industrieel ingenieur.
Je hebt kennis van R, Python (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy), Exploratory Data Analysis.
Je hebt een affiniteit voor verschillende machine learning-algoritmen, zoals regressie, classificatie, clustering en deep learning.
Een eerste ervaring met Matplotlib, Seaborn, of Tableau en met big data technologieën (Hadoop, Spark of NoSQL databases) is een plus.
Je bent vertrouwd met databases en query-talen zoals SQL om gegevens efficiënt te kunnen opslaan en ophalen.
Je spreekt Nederlands en je kunt je vloeiend uitdrukken in het Engels.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Manager Data Scientist
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.




#technology

Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Knowledge of dutch is a big plus


We offer

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions
Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…
Show more
HTML:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

  • A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
  • An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
  • Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
  • Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
  • A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.



#technology

Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

  • Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
  • A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
  • Other types of eduction are also valued.
  • A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
  • Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
  • Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
  • The desire to learn and grow
  • A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
  • Knowledge of dutch is a big plus

We offer

The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

  • Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
  • Mentoring colleagues
  • Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions
  • Gathering and organizing data
  • Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution

  • Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist IT profiles
  • Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You’ll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!




At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning / NLP Expert
HTML:
Twenty8 is an independent firm delivering IT services to international organizations, with a focus on supporting digital transformation, business development, and customer-centric solutions.

We collaborate closely with European Union public institutions and agencies, helping skilled professionals navigate and grow in their international careers.


We are currently seeking an experienced Data Scientist/Machine Learning/NLP Expert to support a prestigious European Institution in Brussels. 🔍🇪🇺


🖥️ KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions;
  • Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.


📝 REQUIREMENTS:


  • 12+ years of experience in IT or a relevant field;
  • University degree in Computer Science/IT/Engineering;
  • C1/C2 level of English (French B1+ preferred);
  • Excellent knowledge of Python, Matlab, R and its NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy/NLTK/scikit-learn/pandas);
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms (k-NN/Naive Bayes/SVM/Decision Forests/Neural Network) and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Management;
  • Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure;
  • Good knowledge of the Linux environment;
  • Knowledge of NoSQL databases (MongoDB/Cassandra/HBase) and data visualization tools (D3.js/GGplot).


This is a hybrid role, requiring on-site presence at the Brussels office just one day per week. 📍


Ready to Apply?

If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!

Submit your CV today and embark on an exciting journey with us! 📩

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Organisation

Bluesquare is a fast growing technology company focusing on Global Health. Bluesquare’s goal is to help Global Health resources get where it matters the most. We partner with Global Health Funds, national governments, health service purchasers, and NGOs, to help them make smarter health investments. Bluesquare’s technologies are in use in more than 30 countries and support +60 different clients, including the World Bank, the WHO, the Global Fund to Fight HIV, TB and Malaria, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, leading NGOs and consultancies.




For more information about who we are: https://bluesquarehub.com/




Mission and description of the role

We are looking for a Data Scientist with experience in data analysis and visualisation to join our data science team.




Start date: as soon as possible.




Location: Based in Brussels (preferably) but willing to travel to other countries in order to support Bluesquare’s projects. Bluesquare takes into account the safety risks of its employees in the areas concerned.




Team: We are a horizontal company with more than 80 team members in multiple countries. The Data Science team is composed of friendly, supportive and enthusiastic young individuals distributed across Europe and Africa.




We value ownership, autonomy, flexibility, communication and teamwork. We strive for excellence in the solutions we provide for pressing challenges, emphasizing continuous self-improvement and supporting the individual development of our team members. Nevertheless, we firmly prioritize work-life balance, well-being, and recognizing each person as a unique individual for an optimal working environment.




Role and Responsibilities




Data Management & Analysis:

In collaboration with the data science team, develop scripts in R or Python for data cleaning, data processing, data integration and data quality screening.
Apply your technical skills in DHIS2 to contribute to improving the management of health data.




Automation of procedures

Contribution to the automation of the procedures via different scripting languages (Python, R) in command line or on the Bluesquare data analytics platform OpenHexa in collaboration with the development team.
Provide technical support and documentation on the procedures established.
Write code documentation, user guidelines, articles and other materials that will be useful to communicate with our clients and other partners.




Product development:

Contribute to Bluesquare’s products, processes, procedures and tools (product roadmap, user manual, training material, etc.) based on ongoing client needs analysis.




Data visualisation:

Set up dashboards using different BI and visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI..) to answer clients’ needs, and develop customised applications for data visualisation.




Quality control:

Review and automate scripts to ensure quality control of the released data integration work.




Technical writing:

Write code documentation, users guidelines, articles and other materials that will be useful to communicate with our clients and other partners.




Capacity building

Provide internal and external trainings for stakeholders in the use of different tools and in-house data solutions
Adapt the curricula of the training sessions to the specific needs of the respective stakeholders
Support other teams in their needs for data analysis based on ongoing needs assessment




Additional responsibilities

Contribute to the company visibility/networking on health data systems and Bluesquare visibility (blogs, product descriptions, events)




Our technical stack

You will have to work with the following technologies and software:

Python or R for data processing (data wrangling, forecasting, operational research, geospatial)
The Jupyter data science ecosystem
Data visualisation tools and BI software (Tableau, PowerBI, Superset, Matplotlib, Plotly, Dash,…)
Our own platforms, such as OpenHexa, Iaso and OpenIMIS
Industry-standard tools such as DHIS2 and ODK
Geospatial Software (GDAL, QGIS, Cartographic Rendering Software, etc.)
Data




Profile

Required

Master degree in data management and analysis, statistics, econometrics…
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Working experience in data analysis (e.g. R or Python), in database management (e.g. SQL)
1-3 years of experience in R/Python programming and with creating scripts to manipulate, clean and analyse data
Good working knowledge of the Jupyter ecosystem
Excellent oral and written communication skills in French and English
Ability to work autonomously
Team player with good interpersonal skills




Preferred

Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or deployment of containerized applications.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure.
Experience and familiarity with practices, software and working environment of CICD, DevOps.
Experience with time series forecasting, operational research, supply chain, geosciences
Experience in Global health, Health financing, Disease Surveillance, Geospatial or Monitoring and Evaluation in another sector a plus
Experience with GIS (Geographical Information System) and familiarity with Environmental dataset sources (ex: Google Earth Engine)
Experience with DHIS2 configuration for management of health and with ODK for the creation of forms
Experience with BI tools & with the creation of interactive dashboards (Tableau, Power BI, Superset)
Working experience in Africa, Asia or Latin America




What we offer

We are open to considering candidates on a freelance basis.




Competitive Salary and benefits package
Flexible work hours and extensive remote working options, as we entrust our team members, anticipating a responsible and conscientious utilisation of this trust.
Exciting projects: use data to solve major issues (Health, Education, Waste management, Public Funding Optimization and more)
Impact: manage data platforms impacting the lives of thousands of people
Network: work in collaboration with a wide variety of actors within countries (Ministries, Donors, NGOs, Implementing partners, field staff, etc.)
Hands-on experience: on-site visits and in-depth situation analysis, because we believe that nothing compares to experiencing first-hand the change one is contributing to.
Exciting work environment: join a result-oriented, dynamic & diverse team committed to improve the accessibility and quality of health services, especially for the poorest




To apply, please send your CV and motivation letter to datascientistbru@bluesquare1.odoo.com.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking experienced Machine Learning Engineers and MLOps Engineers with a strong background in data preparation, Snowflake, and Databricks. Ideal candidates will have hands-on experience in Generative AI (GenAI), particularly in predicting customer journeys or similar applications (e.g., Intelligent Digital Companion / IDC projects).




Responsibilities:

Develop and optimize ML models using structured and unstructured data.
Collaborate with data scientists to prepare training data (ETL) using Snowflake and Databricks.
Implement GenAI solutions for customer journey prediction and behaviour modelling.
Evaluate model performance and ensure scalability in production environments.




Key Details:

Length : 6 Months ( + possible extension )
Location : Fully Remote
Industry : Pharmaceutical
Start Date : ASAP




Required Skills:

Proficiency with Snowflake, Databricks, and Python-based ML libraries.
Experience with Generative AI applications, particularly customer journey prediction or similar.
Strong background in data engineering, model deployment, and ML lifecycle management.
Familiarity with tools like MLflow, Docker, Kubernetes, or Airflow is a plus.




Nice to Have:

Exposure to NLP or LLMs (e.g., GPT-based systems).
Experience in regulated industries (e.g., pharma, finance).
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)










If you are available for this opportunity please apply below for immediate consideration Thank you.

  • Strong background in data engineering, model deployment, and ML lifecycle management.
  • Familiarity with tools like MLflow, Docker, Kubernetes, or Airflow is a plus.


Nice to Have:

  • Exposure to NLP or LLMs (e.g., GPT-based systems).
  • Experience in regulated industries (e.g., pharma, finance).
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)




If you are available for this opportunity please apply below for immediate consideration Thank you.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
(FREELANCE)

Job Title: AI Engineer




Location: Brussels, Belgium

Job Type: Freelance

Industry: Manufacturing

Work Mode: Hybrid (On-site presence required 2 days/week)




About the Client:

Our client is a leading manufacturing company based in Brussels, committed to driving innovation through digital transformation and smart automation. They are currently investing in Artificial Intelligence to enhance operations, streamline production, and boost efficiency across their facilities.




Role Overview:

We are seeking a skilled AI Engineer to develop, implement, and optimize AI/ML solutions within the manufacturing environment. The ideal candidate will work closely with domain experts, data scientists, and process engineers to identify opportunities for AI integration, improve operational processes, and support data-driven decision-making.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop AI and ML models for use cases such as predictive maintenance, defect detection, process optimization, and demand forecasting.
Work with industrial IoT data, machine logs, and sensor data to train and validate models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define AI opportunities and implement prototypes or production-grade solutions.
Deploy and monitor AI models in production environments using appropriate MLOps practices.
Translate business requirements into technical solutions that deliver real business impact.
Document models, processes, and findings in a clear and structured way for stakeholders.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in building and deploying AI/ML models, preferably in an industrial or manufacturing setting.
Strong experience with Python and libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and MLOps tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, etc.).
Experience working with time-series, sensor data, and/or image data (e.g., computer vision).
Knowledge of manufacturing systems (MES, PLCs, SCADA) is a plus.
Fluent in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is a strong advantage.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
HTML:
Role: Semantic AI Expert


Location: Remote


Your Tasks:

  • Support activities related to integrating AI into Semantic Interoperability through various initiatives , focusing on exploration and proposing production solutions, particularly regarding agentic AI;
  • Support the SEMIC support to EU policies, and provide technical support for Interoperability Assessment data modelling activities, SDGR/OOTS, and interoperability in Data Spaces;
  • Provide support on the SEMIC toolchain, with benchmarking, and identifying open-source solutions to support data modelling activities;
  • Support the formalisation, integration, and Member States adoption of Linked Data Event Streams (LDES) as a SEMIC specification, ensuring alignment with existing standards and EU data strategies;
  • Assist in the continuous improvement and implementation support for DCAT-AP, including providing guidance to Data paces on adopting the profile and assist in creating additional sub-profiles where necessary;
  • Be actively involved in the creation of blog post publications on modelling approaches and practices;
  • Involvement in organisation and implementation of SEMIC webinars and workshops.


Requirements

  • Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Information and Communication Technologies, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 8 years experience in Semantic methodologies, Semantic transformation, Metadata modelling, Linked data;
  • Minimum 8 years experience in OWL, RDF, SKOS, XML, shacl;
  • Proven work experience with machine learning and AI models in particular new trends working on agents;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join Our Team as a Data Scientist in the thriving iGaming Industry! 🚀




🧩Who we are?

Ludicrum is redefining iGaming, blending creativity with technology to deliver world-class gaming experiences. From marketing and product development to customer support and financial reporting, our teams are changing the game. Our vision is to create ultra-intuitive and engaging platforms to fuel growth through strategic partnerships and market expansion.

Our success is driven by core values deeply embedded in our culture. We believe in transparency, always being clear, open, and honest. We are goal-focused, relentlessly pursuing our targets. Adaptability is key—we embrace change and use it to excel. Kaizen guides us, as we continuously improve, test, and refine.

With a dynamic and collaborative culture and fast career growth, our 250+ global team thrives!




🥜 In a nutshell

As a Data Scientist, you will turn complex data into impactful insights through statistical analysis, machine learning models, and experimental design. Your work will inform key decisions across product, marketing, and operations—helping us uncover player behavior, improve retention, and scale smartly.




🎯 The responsibilities & the impact YOU will have:

Analyze large structured and unstructured datasets to identify trends and generate actionable insights.
Build and deploy machine learning models for forecasting, classification, and recommendation use cases.
Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to translate business problems into analytical solutions.
Design and run A/B tests and other experiments to measure the impact of product or process changes.
Create clear dashboards and visualizations that effectively communicate results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data quality and pipeline reliability.
Maintain thorough documentation of code, models, methodologies, and assumptions.
Stay current on emerging tools, techniques, and best practices in data science.




⚡ All you need is…

Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist or similar analytical role, with strong command of SQL and experience working with large datasets.
Proficiency in Python (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn) or R for data analysis and building predictive models.
Hands-on experience with statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and A/B testing methodologies.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Oracle BI, and ability to present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Solid grasp of experimental design and a structured approach to validating data-driven decisions.
Working knowledge of version control tools like Git and collaboration across cross-functional teams.

Nice to have

Familiarity with streaming data tools like Apache Kafka or Spark Streaming.
Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and reproducible workflows.
Experience with distributed systems and working with large-scale datasets.
Proficiency with Oracle BI for dashboards and reporting.
Comfort using Jira for task and project tracking.




🌟 Why You’ll love working here:

Flexible and Remote Working: Work from anywhere, supporting your work-life balance.
Career Growth: We’re committed to your development, offering training and advancement opportunities.
Performance Bonuses: Earn bonuses based on company and personal performance.
Health and Fitness Benefits: Receive fitness reimbursements from day one, and after one year of employment, gain access to a health budget to support your well-being.
Extra Paid Annual Leave: Enjoy 22 days of vacation, with an additional day added for each year of employment, up to a maximum of 26 days.
Special Birthday Perk: Take your birthday off after a year of employment to celebrate!




We are not just offering a job; we offer the chance to be part of something bigger. Apply today! Submit your resume in English and join us in creating unforgettable experiences. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.




Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:

You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals




Main Qualifications

Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing




Top reasons to work with us:

Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As a collaborator in the Machine Learning team, you ensure the different predictive models and algorithms are running qualitatively and on time in the production environment also called the model factory. The mission of the machine learning engineer is key because this role makes the bridge between the products delivered by the Data Science team and the usage of the business.




The machine learning engineer will also cover some more technical missions as for example web scraping, POC’s concerning AI & Generative AI (in order to ensure a move to production for those POC’s).




The Machine Learning team is responsible for the quality of the models and as a consequence of the value created by the models that will be used by all the internal clients.




Your responsibilities:

Deploy large scale machine learning models and other scripts into production environment (in cloud and on-premise environments)
Review, optimize and simplify the code to ensure quality and reusability
Monitor the quality of input variables and the performances of the models’ outputs.
Contribute to parts of the ML pipeline, such as data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate models into production.
Monitor model performance and updates models as needed
Solve well-defined machine learning problems and may work on smaller projects or parts of larger projects.
Apply existing algorithms and techniques to specific business problems




Specific expertise:

Expert understanding of git, experience with CI/CD pipelines;
Proficiency at Python and solid knowledge of at least one deep learning framework such as TensorFlow / Keras or PyTorch is a must.
Good knowledge of computational infrastructure;
Basic knowledge of Terraform;
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, general deep learning, predictive modelling and Generative AI in order to be able to challenge the inputs and the outputs produced by the Data Science team
Understanding of Google Cloud Platform, ML Ops principles and software development tools/best practices;
Expertise in Data Ingestion / Processing and Modelling: you are able to express complex data needs and understand data quality-cleansing processes & methods
Extensive Corporate Data Knowledge: aware of critical company business processes and underlying data, you are able to challenge data quality
Fluency in SQL for writing efficient queries on large datasets
Good knowledge of Linux operating system
Ability to write robust code in Python, R and Java
Good to have: good knowledge of networking, multiprocessing, parallel computing and real-time computations;
Should be able to challenge the inputs and outputs of AI and Gen AI products as well as the way it was built.




Your profile:

Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics) or equivalent work experience. with 2-5 years of experience in machine learning or related fields
Proficient in key machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Analytical thinking and self-learning spirit
Strong programming and data analytics skills
Able to work and collaborate transversally
Good communication and presentation skills (vulgarisation)
Collaboration skills (with other data scientists, data engineers and other teams)
Capacity to influence and engage, assertiveness and being diplomatic
Customer-oriented and pragmatic
Stress resistant
Fluent English and fluent French or Dutch




Our offer:

You will make the difference in this highly innovative vibe. As a result, you will develop your full potential by working with highly skilled colleagues and through continuous training. Moreover, you can count on a highly competitive and versatile compensation (market competitive salary, company car or legal mobility budget, homeworking and net allowance, performance bonus, meal vouchers) and benefits package.




Inspired? Please send us your resume and we will rapidly get back to you to invite you for further interviews.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We are building the world's greatest community of remote technologists!




Today, organizations that understand the value of remote working will reap the rewards. Because it doesn’t just provide team members with a healthier work-life balance — it gives you the opportunity to access the brightest minds in the world.




Our clients access our community to build or extend their existing teams. All are made up of remote, distributed software engineering experts — best-in-class. Rapidly deployed without compromising on quality.




Join our Remobi community to work on meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate.




📅 Duration: Until end of September 2025 (likely extension)

⏱ Hours: Part-Time – 20 hours per week

🌍 Location: Fully Remote (EU-based candidates only)

📄 Contract Type: Freelance / B2B / Contract




Summary:




We’re looking for a highly skilled AI Engineer to join a cutting-edge project with one of the world’s largest energy companies. You’ll build AI-driven solutions that go beyond traditional NLP — leveraging LLMs, RAG pipelines, and generative AI methods to transform how the business retrieves and interacts with unstructured data across the enterprise.




This is a part-time, high-impact role ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex NLP problems using modern AI tools and technologies.




How You’ll Make an Impact




You will be responsible for:




Building and optimizing retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines to search and synthesize insights from internal documentation
Applying generative AI techniques and LLMs to enhance document intelligence and question-answering systems
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand NLP challenges and deliver tailored AI-powered solutions
Working with Python, vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate), and embedding models to create semantic search workflows
Integrating your work into production environments using scalable APIs and cloud infrastructure
Staying up to date on the latest advancements in open-source LLMs, prompt engineering, and NLP research




What You Bring (Skills, Capabilities)




Strong software engineering skills in Python, with a focus on AI/ML/NLP applications
Hands-on experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT-4, Claude, LLaMA, Mistral) and building RAG systems
Experience working with LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar frameworks
Proficiency in vector search, embedding generation, and document chunking
Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and deployment best practices
A proactive mindset and the ability to operate independently in a fully remote, part-time setting
Bonus: Experience in large enterprise or industrial domains (e.g., energy, manufacturing)

Show more

Our clients access our community to build or extend their existing teams. All are made up of remote, distributed software engineering experts — best-in-class. Rapidly deployed without compromising on quality.


Join our Remobi community to work on meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate.


📅 Duration: Until end of September 2025 (likely extension)

⏱ Hours: Part-Time – 20 hours per week

🌍 Location: Fully Remote (EU-based candidates only)

📄 Contract Type: Freelance / B2B / Contract


Summary:


We’re looking for a highly skilled AI Engineer to join a cutting-edge project with one of the world’s largest energy companies. You’ll build AI-driven solutions that go beyond traditional NLP — leveraging LLMs, RAG pipelines, and generative AI methods to transform how the business retrieves and interacts with unstructured data across the enterprise.


This is a part-time, high-impact role ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex NLP problems using modern AI tools and technologies.


How You’ll Make an Impact


You will be responsible for:


  • Building and optimizing retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines to search and synthesize insights from internal documentation
  • Applying generative AI techniques and LLMs to enhance document intelligence and question-answering systems
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand NLP challenges and deliver tailored AI-powered solutions
  • Working with Python, vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate), and embedding models to create semantic search workflows
  • Integrating your work into production environments using scalable APIs and cloud infrastructure
  • Staying up to date on the latest advancements in open-source LLMs, prompt engineering, and NLP research


What You Bring (Skills, Capabilities)


  • Strong software engineering skills in Python, with a focus on AI/ML/NLP applications
  • Hands-on experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT-4, Claude, LLaMA, Mistral) and building RAG systems
  • Experience working with LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar frameworks
  • Proficiency in vector search, embedding generation, and document chunking
  • Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and deployment best practices
  • A proactive mindset and the ability to operate independently in a fully remote, part-time setting
  • Bonus: Experience in large enterprise or industrial domains (e.g., energy, manufacturing)

Title: ML/Data Science Engineer
Description:
ML/Data Science Architect/Engineer #2499




Position Summary:




Our partner, an AI-first company founded by engineers and mathematicians, is building a next-gen digital ad platform that leverages counterfactual simulations, temporal modeling, and custom machine learning pipelines to optimize how ads are delivered and adapted in real time. This isn’t a corporate ML role buried in dashboards and legacy tools, this is product-facing engineering, with real math, daily collaboration, and a team full of Olympiad-tier minds. You'll work directly with high-performing engineers and data scientists to design and scale systems that model user behavior, optimize engagement, and make campaign-level predictions with clarity and precision. The team is opinionated, rigorous, and respectful and you’ll be expected to contribute at that level.




Experience and Education:




Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, Machine Learning or a related field (or equivalent experience)
10+ years of hands-on Python development in data science or ML environments
7+ years in applied machine learning, ideally in real-time or product-integrated use cases
Strong mathematical grounding — statistics, optimization, probability, modeling
Experience designing and deploying models in production, not just prototyping
Demonstrated success building and scaling forecasting or behavior prediction systems
Familiarity with high-performance training and inference (GPU-based, distributed, etc.)
Prior work in environments where ML output directly impacts product or revenue




Skills and Strengths:




Machine Learning
Python
TensorFlow
PyTorch
JAX
AutoML
Reinforcement Learning
Counterfactual Simulation
Temporal Modeling
Forecasting Models
Statistical Modeling
Probabilistic Inference
Data Engineering
Data Wrangling
A/B Testing
ML Ops
Docker
AWS (SageMaker, EC2)
Computer Vision (optional)
Linux
Custom Model Deployment




Primary Job Responsibilities:




Architect and scale ML systems that simulate real-world behavior and performance
Build forecasting models, counterfactual engines, and reinforcement learning workflows
Collaborate with engineering leads to shape and execute AI product strategy
Translate ad-domain logic into computational architecture with precision
Continuously tune models for performance, memory, and throughput
Evaluate tradeoffs between deterministic and probabilistic approaches
Help structure experiments and A/B tests to optimize system evolution
Document and explain algorithmic decisions for peer review and transparency
Support the integration of models with real-time application logic
Build reusable tooling that helps the broader ML team move faster
Contribute to internal peer review culture — helping elevate work across the team

Title: Data Science Specialist - OptimusAI (Manufacturing / Industry)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You will be based in our Brussels office as part of McKinsey’s manufacturing AI solution (OptimusAI), which sits at the intersection of three practices

Global Energy and Materials advises production and investor companies across chemicals & agriculture, paper & packaging, metals & mining, oil & gas, and power generation on strategic, operational, and growth issues.

QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey the AI arm of our firm which helps clients transform faster, innovate smart, and anticipate the future.

Operations assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges by developing and implementing operational strategies, initiatives and solutions for their most critical problems. Connecting boardroom strategies to the shopfloor operators.

At the intersection of these groups, OptimusAI is a team of ~10 expert consultants, data scientists and engineers, focused on improving processing plant productivity through data analytics.

We develop real-time AI advisory systems to support decision making in the plant control room, we assess and optimize process control systems, and we unlock plant bottlenecks through data-driven process changes.

OptimusAI supports a global community of consultants by developing an innovative machine learning toolkit and codifying the approach to deliver significant and lasting client impact.

Your Impact

Are you passionate about leveraging analytics to drive real-world impact? As an OptimusAI Data Science Specialist, you will help leading companies across the Energy and Materials sector unlock their full productivity potential using AI.

Collaborating in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team of 3-6 experts, you will use your creativity and analytics expertise to enhance client performance in areas such as energy efficiency, product quality, and capacity. You will be working side-by-side with the client’s process engineers and analytics specialists and will be communicating your work to executive audiences.

Internally, you will collaborate with our talented product engineers to develop innovative products and algorithms to address current and future client needs. You will help codify best practices, radiate our impact in/externally and shape the product roadmap.

Along the way, you will benefit from world-class training in business problem structuring and client advisory, while working closely with senior manufacturing and analytics experts. Experience unparalleled career growth with significant ownership and responsibility from day one, all within a collaborative, diverse, and non-hierarchical environment. Seize the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world.

Ready to deliver direct impact on some of the world's largest industrial players? We invite you to submit a cover letter detailing why you are the perfect fit for our team and how you can contribute to our mission!

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a discipline such as Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Machine Learning or equivalent
4+ years of relevant professional experience in advanced analytics, ideally in the context of heavy industry
Ability to write clean and efficient code in Python; ideally with experience in using cloud computing resources (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure)
Ability to apply and advise on state-of-the-art analytics, machine learning, and optimization techniques to derive business insights and solve complex problems
Excellent problem-solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and effective solutions
Ability to thrive in a flexible, multi-disciplinary and agile working environment
Strong interpersonal communication skills; experience in facilitating discussions with leadership
Track record of completing projects successfully on time as per scope
Willingness to travel to other offices and/or client locations for short/long term assignments
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (AI/ML Focus)
Description:
Description

We're a global IT consulting company and a software development service provider that helps organizations operate at their best. With 30+ years of experience, +6 Global locations, and +1000 employees, TEAM combines technology expertise, valuable insights, business intelligence, and a client-centered approach to address challenges in business operations, digital transformation, risk management, compliance, business continuity, and more.




The client is implementing a new system for anti-money laundering in 30 of their subsidiaries around the world.

The technical part of the project involves assessment of the source data in each country and statistical modelling to set up the new system: segmentation of customers and parametrization of detection scenarios.




Profile requirements:

At least a bachelor's degree in data science or a similar field
At least 12 years of experience with development of machine learning or AI models
Good understanding of machine learning algorithms for classification and clustering
Experience with analysis or processing of financial transactions
Python, Spark and Git
Outstanding English both verbal and written
Experience in the field of anti-financial crime or banking is a plus




Desired Skills

Git

Pyspark

Python




What We Offer

Being a part of TEAM International gives you the chance to work on challenging projects with great professionals, international clients, and the latest technologies.

Flexible engagement models.
Work alongside top IT global talent.
Full compliance with security and regulatory standards.
Customized IT and software development solutions.
A supportive and collaborative work environment.
