Title: Expert in AI /NLP/ ML
HTML:
📌 Expert in AI /NLP/ ML

We are looking for an Expert in AI /NLP/ ML who will integrate the IT team., for a major European institution.

🛠 Your Responsibilities:

  • Design and implementation of AI solutions at REGIO in close collaboration with team management and AI technical lead;
  • Propose or support adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets;
  • Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management;
  • Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions;
  • Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management.

✅ Required Skills & Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP; Proven experience with Deep Learning models, NLP techniques, NLTK, ;
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud);
  • Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI;
  • Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow);
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation;
  • Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail;
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments;
  • Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.

🎯 Specific expertise:

  • Minimum 3 years experience and expertise in the command of Python, R , MongoDB, C++, Matlab, Atlassian with specific hands-on experience linked to relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot.
  • Minimum 1 year experience (expertise) of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing.

Minimum 2 years of hands-on knowledge with Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal) and recent handson experience on using LangChain framework, Hugging Face (in NLP context), hybridsearch and streamlit

  • Outstanding communication skills and ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences;
  • Excellent command of English (see certification requirements below)
  • French and/or German at conversational level or attested through academic studies in either France or Germany;

🎯Certifications:

  • Level of education corresponding to Level 7 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a master degree of 5 years.

Benefits:

✅ Remote model of work from Belgium.

🤝 Long-term Freelance project.

🌍 Participate on a multicultural and collaborative team, with clear processes and a focus on a major European institution.

Be part of the EU’s digital future.

Apply now to help shape high-impact solutions!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together

Job Description

We have an opening for a person with a passion for data science & AI, interested in solving concrete business projects in a wide variety of domains and applications.

In this role, you will work closely with other Data Profiles from Sopra Steria but also from our clients’ internal teams. You will lead the way and participate in multiple advanced analytics & AI projects from the ideation phase to the value delivery. Every step of the way, you will ensure the quality of the analytical solution as well as the actionability towards the business stakeholders.

Does this sound like your ideal day-to-day drill? Then don’t wait any longer and let’s meet.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have multiple years of industry experience in building and delivering a variety of data science & AI applications / solutions
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information, in order to turn this information into value. You have acquired relevant skills through your past experiences
You are proficient in Python (all other programming languages are a plus).
You have worked on at least one cloud provider
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results. You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input
You can work independently, but you also appreciate collaboration. You are open-minded and have no fear of expressing your opinion in a constructive way
You are proficient in English. You are also fluent in Dutch or French.
Experience in project management and people management is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data scientist - AI engineer H/F
Description:
At LittleBigCode, a fast-growing and dynamic company, we push the boundaries of data and artificial intelligence to deliver cutting-edge solutions to today’s technological challenges. Our talented team is committed to innovation, knowledge sharing, and deploying breakthrough technologies in a collaborative and inspiring environment. If you're passionate about generative AI, large language models, and multimodal systems — and want to play a key role in a pioneering team — this opportunity is made for you.







Missions

Design, develop, and deploy GenAI models, with a focus on large language models (LLMs) and multimodal systems

Build, fine-tune, and optimize AI agents capable of autonomous reasoning, planning, and task execution

Develop end-to-end GenAI pipelines, from data ingestion and preprocessing to model serving and monitoring

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, data science) to integrate GenAI solutions into real-world applications

Implement prompt engineering and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) strategies to enhance model performance and relevance

Ensure solutions meet security, scalability, latency, and ethical AI standards

Stay up to date with the latest research and advancements in the generative AI landscape and apply them strategically

Provide technical leadership and mentorship to other engineers in the AI/ML and software teams




Profile




We are looking for an experienced GenAI Engineer to join our newly established Generative AI team. This role calls for a skilled leader with a strong track record in developing advanced AI solutions and AI Agents powered by large language models (LLM). As one of the principal Engineers, you will play a key role in shaping our Generative AI strategy and roadmap, ensuring we remain at the cutting edge of AI innovation.




You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics) and have at least 3 years of experience as a Sofware Developer / GenAI Engineer

Excellent Software engineering background in Python, (developing application, API, frontend integration, security best practices)

Extensive knowledge of cloud services and tools (Azure, AWS,GCP)

Deep understanding of LLMs fine-tuning and/or training lifecycle (LLMops)

Hands-on experience with prompt engineering for LLMs (e.g., GPT-3, Gemini, etc.)

Experience in fine-tuning pre-trained language models for specific tasks.

You have a good knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases such as GCP BigQuery,PostgreSQL, Cassandra, MongoDB

You should be proficient in modern DevOps technologies.

Specifically, you should have hands-on experience with at least one key tool-such as Kubernetes, Terraform, or Helm

You are Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist – Python Migration & Grid Modelling




Location: Brussels (Monnoyer)

Duration: Initially Until 31/12/2025

Part-time: Can vary between 2 or 5 days a week

Setup: Freelance (day rate)




We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to lead the industrialisation and full Python migration of our existing analytical scripts used in conjunction with DigSilent PowerFactory. This is a high-impact role requiring technical fluency, stakeholder collaboration, and a sharp eye for data integrity.

You will own the development of a robust, modular Python toolchain that replaces legacy scripts, enhances performance, and introduces new features. Key tasks include refactoring code to isolate PowerFactory dependencies, optimising performance for large-scale data, and ensuring input completeness.

You’ll collaborate closely with business experts to automate manual processes, ensuring the solution is scalable and production-ready. Your work will contribute directly to energy grid modelling, integrating new capacity changes based on complex hypotheses.




Key Technologies & Skills:

Python (minimum 5 years’ experience): Efficient, modular, and scalable programming
Advanced Analytics: Handling large datasets with performance in mind
Profiling & Optimisation: Speed and memory efficiency
Documentation & Maintainability: Clear code and user guidance
DigSilent PowerFactory: Integration understanding (desirable)
Electric Power Systems: Basic domain knowledge is a plus




Requirements:

Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Highly organised, autonomous, and deadline-focused
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Valid work and residence permit for Belgium (if non-EU)




This role offers a unique opportunity to merge data science with energy systems engineering, delivering real-world impact through technical innovation.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - (Freelance) - Remote




**We are only able to accept applications from candidates who currently reside in Estonia, Poland, Slovakia or Spain, please only apply if you are in these locations.**




Overview:

An innovative and forward-thinking team is seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to support the development of cutting-edge conversational AI systems. This freelance/contract opportunity is ideal for a skilled professional passionate about building intelligent interfaces powered by the latest in language models, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and agent-based AI systems. You’ll be working at the intersection of backend engineering and AI/ML, helping build advanced digital assistants that enhance both customer-facing and internal user experiences.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop backend components for natural language understanding, dialogue management, and response generation.
Implement and optimise AI/ML algorithms for scalability and efficiency.
Integrate large language models and other ML components into conversational platforms.
Monitor system performance and iterate on improvements based on data and feedback.
Stay informed of emerging trends in NLP, LLMs, and ML infrastructure; incorporate relevant advances into the platform.
Continuously enhance ML pipelines and operational workflows.
Collaborate on code reviews and contribute to a high-standard engineering culture.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Machine Learning, or a related technical discipline.
5+ years of experience in product development with a strong foundation in conversational AI and generative technologies.
Demonstrated expertise in NLP, LLMs, and RAG-based architectures.
Strong coding proficiency in Python and familiarity with ML ecosystems (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, FastAPI, vector databases).
Experience deploying and integrating machine learning models in real-world applications.
Solid understanding of backend systems, APIs, microservices, and modern cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, Azure).
Familiarity with model deployment best practices and MLOps tools.
Effective written and spoken communication in English.

Title: Data Scientist met een ❤️ voor marketing
Description:
Data Scientist met een ❤️ voor marketing




Wij zijn op zoek naar een Data Scientist om ons team van performance marketeers te versterken. Krijg je energie van data-analyse en het toepassen van Data Science op zakelijke vraagstukken? Wil je jouw kennis van Google Analytics 4, BigQuery, Media data tools, CRM en Marketing automation tools uitleven en verder uitdiepen? En heb je interesse om andere mensen te helpen bij het begrijpen van data en data science? Als het volgende je aanspreekt, lees dan vooral door.




Wat zou je doen




Als Data Scientist bij Ants bestaat je job uit twee luiken.




LUIK 1: Data tracking, configuratie en dashboarding:

Digital marketing tracking uitvoering: alle hedendaagse trackinguitdagingen die ermee te maken hebben (server side tracking, GA4, GA alternatives, conversion APIs, ...)
Data visualisatie & dashboarding (Looker Studio, PowerBI of andere)
Data strategy met focus op marketing: verzamelen, opslaan, beheren, analyseren en gebruiken van data, evenals processen en tools.
Data architectuur bepalen voor marketing (marketing CRM databases, marketing automation databases, ...)




LUIK 2: Product Development

Automatiseren en productiseren van processen (denk KWR, audits, enz.)
Opportuniteiten spotten in dagelijkse werking waar data en automatisatie een weerwaarde kan spelen.
Ontwikkelen en uitwerken van tools die bijdragen aan onze werking en aan de werking van onze projecten met onze klanten.




Je profiel




KENNIS

Je hebt ervaring in marketing en data-analyse
Ervaring met het beheren van databases
Google Cloud Platform en Big Query zijn voor jou geen ongekend terrein
Diepgaande kennis van SQL (GoogleSQL)
Kennis van Python of R is een pluspunt
Ervaring met marketingcampagnes en het meten van resultaten
Kennis van andere digitale marketingkanalen: je hebt een breder begrip van digitale marketingkanalen en hoe deze in combinatie met Google Ads gebruikt kunnen worden om bedrijfsdoelstellingen te bereiken. In het bijzonder ook aandacht voor Bing Ads




ATTITUDE

Sterke analytische vaardigheden en de mogelijkheid om data te vertalen naar actiegerichte inzichten.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden om campagneprestaties aan stakeholders te communiceren en aanbevelingen voor verbetering te doen.
Een innovatieve mindset. Je ziet mogelijkheden om te automatiseren, te productiseren en hoe data kan bijdragen aan dagelijkse processen.
Je bent hands-on, oplossingsgericht, zoekt graag zaken uit en werkt goed zelfstandig.




Waarom Ants?

Je werkt samen met seniors = veel bijleren en vooral de juiste dingen doen die werken.
Volledige ownership = jij bepaalt mee de analyses die we moeten doen, we luisteren naar je inzichten en voorstellen. Je kan mee vorm geven aan je planning en roadmap.
Gebeten door data = cijfers zijn steeds onze leidraad. We spreken jou taal.
Je krijgt de tijd, ondersteuning en budget om een individueel groeiplan te volgen.




Wat we aanbieden

Een aantrekkelijk loon afhankelijk van je ervaring en skillset aangevuld met:




26 dagen verlof + 1 anciënniteitsdag per gewerkt jaar
Maaltijdcheques à 8 EUR/gewerkte dag
Ecocheques (250 EUR)
Hospitalisatieverzekering zonder franchise
Cafetariaplan (waaronder 4d extra verlof per jaar, bureau- en IT-materiaal, pensioensparen, ...)
Laptop (keuze tussen PC of Mac)
Tussenkomst in GSM- en internetabonnement
Opleidingsbudget
Deels van thuis uit werken
Free lunch op woensdag
Wagen afhankelijk van je senioriteit
Je kan in zowel Antwerpen als Gent werken
en nog meer zoets ...




Onze bedrijfscultuur: zacht voor mensen, hard voor resultaten.

Hands-on mentaliteit: we get stuff done en verkopen geen dure woorden.
Transparantie: we houden de klant op de hoogte van wat we precies doen en rapporteren veelvuldig.
Ondersteuning: niets zo eenzaam als in een job zitten waar je bij niemand terechtkan. We zullen je met de volle 100% ondersteunen in je eigen groei. Daar hebben we zelf een gecertificeerd business coach voor.
Zacht voor mensen, hard voor resultaten: we leggen de lat hoog en verwachten dat de kwaliteit steeds top is. En tegelijkertijd respecteren en bewaken we (ook) jouw energie- en tijdsinvestering: glijdende uren, van thuis uit werken, geen overboekte planning, extra verlof, check-in momenten, ...




Klinkt goed?

Welkom dan bij Ants, een digital marketing agency 35 m/v sterk, met kantoren in het legendarische Dok-Noord te Gent en aan het stadspark in Antwerpen-centrum. Samen met onze klanten doen wij aan performance marketing, online advertising, data & analytics en digitale strategie.

We groeien volop, en zijn op zoek naar een Data Scientist die goesting heeft om mee te groeien door kwaliteit voorop te zetten!




🎈Wat zegt je buikgevoel?

We horen graag van je! Neem met een gerust hart contact op met ons en stuur je CV mee.

Show more

  4. Diepgaande kennis van SQL (GoogleSQL)
  5. Kennis van Python of R is een pluspunt
  6. Ervaring met marketingcampagnes en het meten van resultaten
  7. Kennis van andere digitale marketingkanalen: je hebt een breder begrip van digitale marketingkanalen en hoe deze in combinatie met Google Ads gebruikt kunnen worden om bedrijfsdoelstellingen te bereiken. In het bijzonder ook aandacht voor Bing Ads

  4. Je krijgt de tijd, ondersteuning en budget om een individueel groeiplan te volgen.


Wat we aanbieden

Een aantrekkelijk loon afhankelijk van je ervaring en skillset aangevuld met:


  1. 26 dagen verlof + 1 anciënniteitsdag per gewerkt jaar
  2. Maaltijdcheques à 8 EUR/gewerkte dag
  3. Ecocheques (250 EUR)
  4. Hospitalisatieverzekering zonder franchise
  5. Cafetariaplan (waaronder 4d extra verlof per jaar, bureau- en IT-materiaal, pensioensparen, ...)
  6. Laptop (keuze tussen PC of Mac)
  7. Tussenkomst in GSM- en internetabonnement
  8. Opleidingsbudget
  9. Deels van thuis uit werken
  10. Free lunch op woensdag
  11. Wagen afhankelijk van je senioriteit
  12. Je kan in zowel Antwerpen als Gent werken
  13. en nog meer zoets ...


Onze bedrijfscultuur: zacht voor mensen, hard voor resultaten.

  • Hands-on mentaliteit: we get stuff done en verkopen geen dure woorden.
  • Transparantie: we houden de klant op de hoogte van wat we precies doen en rapporteren veelvuldig.
  • Ondersteuning: niets zo eenzaam als in een job zitten waar je bij niemand terechtkan. We zullen je met de volle 100% ondersteunen in je eigen groei. Daar hebben we zelf een gecertificeerd business coach voor.
  • Zacht voor mensen, hard voor resultaten: we leggen de lat hoog en verwachten dat de kwaliteit steeds top is. En tegelijkertijd respecteren en bewaken we (ook) jouw energie- en tijdsinvestering: glijdende uren, van thuis uit werken, geen overboekte planning, extra verlof, check-in momenten, ...


Klinkt goed?

Welkom dan bij Ants, een digital marketing agency 35 m/v sterk, met kantoren in het legendarische Dok-Noord te Gent en aan het stadspark in Antwerpen-centrum. Samen met onze klanten doen wij aan performance marketing, online advertising, data & analytics en digitale strategie.

We groeien volop, en zijn op zoek naar een Data Scientist die goesting heeft om mee te groeien door kwaliteit voorop te zetten!


🎈Wat zegt je buikgevoel?

We horen graag van je! Neem met een gerust hart contact op met ons en stuur je CV mee.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We are Remobi - We empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high performing, high quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist

Duration: Until the end of September 2025 (With the possibility of being extended)

Position Type: Freelance/Contract/B2B

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain machine learning models, including but not limited to, predictive models, natural language processing models, and computer vision models.
Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy machine learning solutions.
Develop algorithms and statistical models to optimize machine learning models and improve their accuracy.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advances in machine learning and data science.

Expected Skills & Capabilities

Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and neural networks.
Understanding and experience with AWS SageMaker
Background working closely with Snowflake
Experience with cloud-based machine learning platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud.
Excellent analytical skills and profound expertise in the application of statistical modeling
Demonstrate excellent programming skills in Python & SQL as well as good skills in related analytical libraries.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Extensive experience with infrastructure as a code (IAC), particularly with AWS CDK.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build advanced machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.




Passionate about data, you enjoy diving deep to uncover actionable insights and develop machine learning models that enhance client operations. You’ll experiment with different approaches, while collaborating with Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists to drive the delivery of tailored, high-quality, end-to-end solutions.




You’ll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master’s or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
Experience with ML versioning tooling.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don’t meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! 🎉

Show more

Title: Machine Learning engineer- expert
Description:
Position Description

Are you a Machine Learning Engineer ready to build smart solutions that make real impact?

At CGI, we’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with 3 to 6 years of experience to join our growing data & AI team. You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary environment where innovation, collaboration, and curiosity are key to success.

Your role in our team


Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models to solve real-world business problems
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into scalable ML solutions
Maintain and optimize existing models and pipelines for performance, accuracy, and efficiency
Contribute to the development of MLOps best practices and model governance frameworks
Stay up to date with the latest ML trends and bring innovation to the team


How You Strengthen Our Team


3 to 6 years of hands-on experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI
Strong skills in Python and ML frameworks like Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or XGBoost
Experience building and deploying models in cloud environments (e.g. AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Familiarity with MLOps tools (e.g. MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow) is a plus
Experience with data pipelines, feature engineering, and model validation
Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
A completed Bachelor's or Master’s degree with a strong IT component
Native Dutch or French with a good English level


A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why CGI?

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organization's, energy and utilities, manufacturing and life sciences companies are CGI's clients. We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.

We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.

At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!

Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.


Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
An immediate permanent contract
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder


What's in it for you ?


Work on cutting-edge projects with tangible business value
Join a passionate and supportive team of experts
Hybrid work environment and flexibility
Personal development budget & learning opportunities


Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Director, Head of AI , via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Young Professional AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about Data Science and AI? As a Young Professional AI Engineer, you’ll be part of OptimAI, a dynamic team that drives innovation in the world of data science and supply chain management through cutting-edge technologies and data-driven solutions.

You’ll join a highly collaborative team working on exciting and impactful projects focused on leveraging data science techniques to solve complex problems. Using agile methodologies, you will support the development of smart, innovative solutions for our clients, helping them navigate AI challenges and drive their digital transformation.

As part of the OptimAI Team, you will:


Contribute to the technical design and implementation of data science and AI solutions.
Work with state-of-the-art tools and techniques in data analysis, machine learning, optimization models, and predictive analytics.
Play an active role in analyzing large datasets, identifying trends, and creating actionable insights.
Collaborate with internal experts and clients to develop tailored solutions and ensure successful project execution.


Qualifications

Skills & Experience We’re Looking For:


A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a related field.
Practical experience or strong interest in applying data science techniques such as machine learning, statistical modeling.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and experience with tools like Pandas, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn is a plus.
Exposure to optimization algorithms (e.g., linear programming, heuristic methods) is highly desirable.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, have a strong grasp of the other, and speak English fluently as well.


What We Offer You:


A comprehensive training program with access to the Sopra Steria Academy, focused on both technical and personal development.
The opportunity to work with leading experts in data science and AI.
Access to over 250 training courses, specialized certifications, and coaching sessions to fast-track your professional growth.
Exposure to challenging and impactful projects with international clients across various industries.
A competitive salary, company car lease or mobility budget, laptop, smartphone, and other benefits like insurance, meal vouchers, and monthly office drinks.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!   

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Compliance Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

About Compliance Analytics & Tooling team

The Analytics & Tooling (A & T) team is a crucial part of the Compliance & Ethics (C&E) department, focusing on driving compliance through data-driven decision making complemented with IT capabilities.

The role

The Analytics and Tooling of Compliance & Ethics team is seeking a Compliance Data Scientist experienced in anti-financial crime solutions. As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in analyzing complex big data sets, developing data use cases, and training predictive models. Your work will directly impact business opportunities within the financial crime area. Join our cross-functional team and contribute to our mission of safeguarding financial integrity and enhancing the reputation of Euroclear as a trusted FMI.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and implement data science use cases, leveraging supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify business opportunities related to financial crime.
Identify, collect, understand, and prepare data (cleansing, enrichment, etc.) for processing.
Implement predictive models to score and prioritize alerts raised by existing and future anomaly detection systems.
Develop anomaly detection algorithms using supervised and unsupervised machine learning models or other relevant data analytics techniques such as Natural Language Processing or graph/network analysis.
Analyze interactions within our ecosystem of counterparts (clients, agents, beneficial owners, etc.) using graph databases and network analytics techniques to detect unsuspected and potentially risky relationships.
Iteratively improve the performance of models in close collaboration with subject matter experts.
Design both static and interactive data visualizations to communicate results clearly and impactfully to stakeholders who may not have a strong background in data science.


This exciting role gives you the opportunity to utilize and broaden your analytical skills to take Euroclear's financial crime capabilities to the next level.

Technical Skills


Master’s or doctoral degree in a quantitative field (e.g., computer science, artificial intelligence, mathematics, physics, statistics).
Minimum of 2 years of experience in developing machine learning models.
Strong programming skills in Python, SQL, and Spark.
Expertise with Scikit-learn and Pandas libraries.
Proficiency in data science techniques and their application in a business context.


Soft Skills


Ability to explain complex analyses to non-technical stakeholders using storytelling and data visualization.
Excellent oral and written communication skills at both technical and business levels.
Exceptional problem-solving abilities, a can-do attitude, creativity, and persistence in understanding and solving business challenges.
Ability to work independently on technical projects while also socializing and interacting with colleagues from both business and IT sides.


Bonus Points


Experience in building data products from design to production.
Experience with any of the following:
Power BI
Hadoop ecosystem
Git
Proficiency in visualization libraries/tools (e.g., Plotly/Dash/NetworkX).
Familiarity with network analytics.
Knowledge of compliance-related domains (sanctions, transaction monitoring, KYC, fraud detection, etc.), ideally in the financial industry.
Previous exposure to generative AI and/or Natural Language Processing.
Familiarity with cloud platforms, preferably Azure.

Join our dynamic team and make an impact in the exciting field in the fight against financial crime and fraud!

What Working At Euroclear Offers


A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Engagement with global teams and projects.


About Euroclear

Euroclear is a leading financial services company that provides post-trade services to financial institutions around the world. We are committed to ensuring compliance and ethics in all our operations and fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.

HTML:
Job Description

About Compliance Analytics & Tooling team

The Analytics & Tooling (A & T) team is a crucial part of the Compliance & Ethics (C&E) department, focusing on driving compliance through data-driven decision making complemented with IT capabilities.

The role

The Analytics and Tooling of Compliance & Ethics team is seeking a Compliance Data Scientist experienced in anti-financial crime solutions. As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in analyzing complex big data sets, developing data use cases, and training predictive models. Your work will directly impact business opportunities within the financial crime area. Join our cross-functional team and contribute to our mission of safeguarding financial integrity and enhancing the reputation of Euroclear as a trusted FMI.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement data science use cases, leveraging supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify business opportunities related to financial crime.
  • Identify, collect, understand, and prepare data (cleansing, enrichment, etc.) for processing.
  • Implement predictive models to score and prioritize alerts raised by existing and future anomaly detection systems.
  • Develop anomaly detection algorithms using supervised and unsupervised machine learning models or other relevant data analytics techniques such as Natural Language Processing or graph/network analysis.
  • Analyze interactions within our ecosystem of counterparts (clients, agents, beneficial owners, etc.) using graph databases and network analytics techniques to detect unsuspected and potentially risky relationships.
  • Iteratively improve the performance of models in close collaboration with subject matter experts.
  • Design both static and interactive data visualizations to communicate results clearly and impactfully to stakeholders who may not have a strong background in data science.

This exciting role gives you the opportunity to utilize and broaden your analytical skills to take Euroclear's financial crime capabilities to the next level.

Technical Skills

  • Master’s or doctoral degree in a quantitative field (e.g., computer science, artificial intelligence, mathematics, physics, statistics).
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in developing machine learning models.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, SQL, and Spark.
  • Expertise with Scikit-learn and Pandas libraries.
  • Proficiency in data science techniques and their application in a business context.

Soft Skills

  • Ability to explain complex analyses to non-technical stakeholders using storytelling and data visualization.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills at both technical and business levels.
  • Exceptional problem-solving abilities, a can-do attitude, creativity, and persistence in understanding and solving business challenges.
  • Ability to work independently on technical projects while also socializing and interacting with colleagues from both business and IT sides.

Bonus Points

  • Experience in building data products from design to production.
  • Experience with any of the following:
    • Power BI
    • Hadoop ecosystem
    • Git
  • Proficiency in visualization libraries/tools (e.g., Plotly/Dash/NetworkX).
  • Familiarity with network analytics.
  • Knowledge of compliance-related domains (sanctions, transaction monitoring, KYC, fraud detection, etc.), ideally in the financial industry.
  • Previous exposure to generative AI and/or Natural Language Processing.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms, preferably Azure.
Join our dynamic team and make an impact in the exciting field in the fight against financial crime and fraud!

What Working At Euroclear Offers

  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  • Engagement with global teams and projects.

About Euroclear

Euroclear is a leading financial services company that provides post-trade services to financial institutions around the world. We are committed to ensuring compliance and ethics in all our operations and fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.

Title: Solver - Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.




At Exsolvæ, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.




Your Role:

As a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.




Preferred Skills

Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.




Technical Implementation

Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.




Project Management

Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We're working with a growing team near Brussels (fully remote option), who are working on a unique SaaS application that help organizations measure, and reduce their environmental impact.




They're currently looking for a Python Developer who is ambitious to work on complex web applications and cloud-based platforms. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining the core platform, ensuring high performance and a smooth experience.




Responsibilities:

Design and maintain backend systems using Python and Flask.
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to build new features.
Deploy cloud infrastructure on AWS.
Write clean and efficient code.
Participate in code reviews, mentoring and business discussions.
Help ensure the platform meets the highest security and performance standards.




Your Profile:

Solid professional experience developing with Python (3+ years preferred).
Strong experience with Flask or similar Python web frameworks.
Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining applications on AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, etc.).
Familiarity with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and RESTful APIs.
Comfortable working in a collaborative, agile environment.
Passion for environmental sustainability is a big plus!




Offer:

Working for a unique, and genuinely impactful company.
Flexible working arrangements including fully remote option.
Between €3.500-€6.500 dependent on experience and interview process.
Chance to work on a complex application and develop your coding skills.
Full package including mobility benefits.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

As an MLOps Engineer, you will help our clients with automating and managing the machine learning lifecyle. More specifically, the responsibilities include design and implement solutions to automate the experimentation and release cycle of machine learning, from traditional ML to LLMs. You identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc, Furthermore, you collaborate with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and other IT roles to integrate all parts of the solution. In addition you implement CI/CD pipelines, IaC, monitoring for models and infrastructure.

In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


At least 3 years of experience as an MLOps Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar position
Experience managing the machine learning lifecycle in production, and related MLOps frameworks
Master CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code
In depth knowledge of containers and container orchestration
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider
Programming experience with Python
Experience with monitoring and logging technologies
Good grasp of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, ElasticSearch, Kafka
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction
Understanding of networking, firewalls, and IT infrastructure
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus


Bonus


Experience with Data Quality and Governance
Experience with Data Engineering


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Research Engineer (junior profile)
Description:
APPLICATION BY EMAIL according to the application rules hereunder (not via LinkedIn). Please attach all the documents asked.




CONTEXT

The Royal Military Academy (RMA) is a military institution and is fully recognized as a university, fulfilling the same criteria as civilian universities. The RMA is also conducting scientific research at university level for projects funded by the Belgian Defense department or external sources.

In the framework of the study DREAM (Distributed REconnaissance And Mapping with a multi-robot system), we are looking for a full-time researcher in computer vision and/or robotics with a Master degree in Engineering Science, Applied Sciences, Civil Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or Mathematics.

We value diversity and equal opportunities. We firmly believe that diversity enriches our community, and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.




PROJECT:

You will work within the 4D Perception Lab (https://4dpl.rma.ac.be/) of the department of Mathematics within the Faculty of Polytechnics of the RMA and in close collaboration with military and humanitarian demining agencies. You will conduct scientific research at university level on a project entitled ‘DREAM’.

The DREAM project aims to develop a robust system of multiple unmanned ground robots to discover and map unknown, potentially dangerous environments, controlled from a VR setting. Imagine navigating and securing environments like the damaged Zaventem airport during the 2016 attacks. Our goal is to integrate robot platforms, robotic arms, and VR technology into a cohesive system that ensures accurate, efficient, and user-friendly shared situational awareness. This multi-agent system will enhance redundancy, mapping speed, and maneuverability in real-world conditions.

MAIN TASKS:

Development of algorithms for 3D localization and mapping of the environment using UGV-based sensors such as light detection and ranging (LiDAR) devices, inertial measurement units (IMUs) and cameras. These algorithms will be based on methods for sensor fusion (filtering and optimization), machine learning (ML), neural radiance fields (NeRFs), Gaussian splatting (GS), etc.
Organisation of measurement campaigns
Writing scientific papers




SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Degree(s) required: Master Degree in Engineering Science, Applied Sciences, Civil Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or Mathematics.

This position is open for junior profiles (ideally 0-3 years of experience) in computer vision and/or robotics.

The possibility to start a PhD related to the project will be offered.

“MUST HAVE” skills:

Training or experience in 3D simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM), state estimation, 3D computer vision or related fields.
Solid understanding of the theoretical foundations of SLAM, state estimation, and related fields.
Experience in programming with C++ or Python and ROS2 in a Linux environment.
Ability to quickly understand and navigate complex systems and established code bases.
Experience with electro-optical data processing.




“NICE TO HAVE” skills:

Training or experience in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and/or Deep Learning.
Experience with 3D visualization frameworks such as Rerun, Three.js, WebGL.
Experience with OpenCV, PyTorch or Tensorflow




Personal skills:

You conduct scientific research in an independent and upright way within a multidisciplinary environment and communicate your results in a clear, concise and precise manner.
You take initiative, solve problems autonomously and find alternatives or solutions.
You are flexible for change and adapt yourself.
You commit yourself in your job by giving the best of your aptitudes in striving toward the highest quality standards and persevere when needed.
You will be working very closely together with the industrial partner and will get insight in their proprietary intellectual property. Confidentiality is therefore an absolute must.

Other skills:

The applicant shall have good knowledge of English (oral / written).
Minimum knowledge of French or Dutch is an added value for collaboration with peers.
A driver’s licence (but not necessarily a car) is highly recommended




Specific Requirements

The researcher may be exposed to classified information and will therefore have to obtain the required security clearance. The candidate must consent with the background check required to obtain this clearance, which will be executed by Belgian Defense.
Only applicants with a nationality of a country that is both part of NATO and the EU will be eligible.
Working for the Patrimony requires living in Belgium for the duration of the study.




Application

Please send by email:

(in the body of your email) a summary containing
Your affinity with the research topic
Your academic degree and years of relevant experience
how your profile matches the list of “must have” and “nice to have” skills listed above, keeping the same structure/numbering as in this job offer
(in attachment) a CV
(in attachment) a scan of both sides of your ID card

to ir Charles HAMESSE (Charles.hamesse@mil.be), Prof Dr ir Rob HAELTERMAN (rob.haelterman@mil.be) and to erm-deao-rswo@mil.be

Please mention clearly the reference of the project: “DREAM”.

Application deadline: 16 MAY 25.

The interviews will take place at the Royal Military Academy, Hobbemastraat 8, 1000 Brussels. If needed, on-line interviews can be organized. The date and time of the interview will be communicated to the preselected candidates.




Contract

Probable date of recruitment: mid-August, in consultation with the applicant.
Status: Full-time employment (38 hours / week) based on an open-ended contract with the Patrimony of the Royal Military Academy (you will not be a civil servant).

If needed:

Please note that your contract will be open-ended, but the financing of the contract will be tied to the funding project, which is guaranteed until October 31st, 2027. The financing of your contract beyond that period is therefore not 100% guaranteed. However, the Patrimony has a policy to keep the good elements on board and the research focus of this job offer fits within our core research activities, so there is a high chance that we will be able to offer you follow-up projects beyond that date.
Wage scale: class A1 (holder of a Master's degree in Science or equivalent), class A2 (holder of an Ir degree or equivalent Master's in Engineering Sciences, doctor’s degree in the same area of expertise). RMA-Patrimony applies a merit-based research career track, allowing researchers to advance in wage scale based upon annual evaluations.
Holiday pay.




Extra legal benefits

Possibility to benefit from a bilingualism allowance (Dutch/French) following a SELOR test;
End-of-year bonus;
Free DKV hospitalization insurance. Possibility of additional affiliation for one or more persons living under the same roof: spouse, child(ren) (50% of the price per additional member);
Bike allowance / Free public transport (home-work commute);
Meal vouchers (6€ / day);
Free access to campus sports facilities outside working hours;
On-campus restaurant and cafeteria with democratic prices (discount on the daily menu);
Flexible working hours within the 38-hour week;
Teleworking possible with allowance (2 days / week max);
Holidays:
29 days holiday / year from the 1st year of contract (then from 45 years: +1 day holiday every 5 years)
1 week OFF every year between Christmas and New year’s Eve (independent of the annual balance of holidays).
Advantages and interesting offers thanks to the Benefits@work card (discounts, vouchers...);
Entitlement to services offered by the ‘Office Central d'Action Sociale et Culturelle de la Défense’ (OCASC): among others holiday centres, discount on travel organised by the tour operator...;
Possibility to benefit from the nursery funded by Belgian Defence (subject to availability).




Workplace

Royal Military Academy, Avenue de la Renaissance 30, 1000 Brussels. Occasional travels abroad for scientific conferences, measurement campaigns, etc.

HTML:
APPLICATION BY EMAIL according to the application rules hereunder (not via LinkedIn). Please attach all the documents asked.


CONTEXT

The Royal Military Academy (RMA) is a military institution and is fully recognized as a university, fulfilling the same criteria as civilian universities. The RMA is also conducting scientific research at university level for projects funded by the Belgian Defense department or external sources.

In the framework of the study DREAM (Distributed REconnaissance And Mapping with a multi-robot system), we are looking for a full-time researcher in computer vision and/or robotics with a Master degree in Engineering Science, Applied Sciences, Civil Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or Mathematics.

We value diversity and equal opportunities. We firmly believe that diversity enriches our community, and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.


PROJECT:

You will work within the 4D Perception Lab (https://4dpl.rma.ac.be/) of the department of Mathematics within the Faculty of Polytechnics of the RMA and in close collaboration with military and humanitarian demining agencies. You will conduct scientific research at university level on a project entitled ‘DREAM’.

The DREAM project aims to develop a robust system of multiple unmanned ground robots to discover and map unknown, potentially dangerous environments, controlled from a VR setting. Imagine navigating and securing environments like the damaged Zaventem airport during the 2016 attacks. Our goal is to integrate robot platforms, robotic arms, and VR technology into a cohesive system that ensures accurate, efficient, and user-friendly shared situational awareness. This multi-agent system will enhance redundancy, mapping speed, and maneuverability in real-world conditions.

MAIN TASKS:

  • Development of algorithms for 3D localization and mapping of the environment using UGV-based sensors such as light detection and ranging (LiDAR) devices, inertial measurement units (IMUs) and cameras. These algorithms will be based on methods for sensor fusion (filtering and optimization), machine learning (ML), neural radiance fields (NeRFs), Gaussian splatting (GS), etc.
  • Organisation of measurement campaigns
  • Writing scientific papers


SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Degree(s) required: Master Degree in Engineering Science, Applied Sciences, Civil Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or Mathematics.

This position is open for junior profiles (ideally 0-3 years of experience) in computer vision and/or robotics.

The possibility to start a PhD related to the project will be offered.

“MUST HAVE” skills:

  1. Training or experience in 3D simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM), state estimation, 3D computer vision or related fields.
  2. Solid understanding of the theoretical foundations of SLAM, state estimation, and related fields.
  3. Experience in programming with C++ or Python and ROS2 in a Linux environment.
  4. Ability to quickly understand and navigate complex systems and established code bases.
  5. Experience with electro-optical data processing.


“NICE TO HAVE” skills:

  1. Training or experience in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and/or Deep Learning.
  2. Experience with 3D visualization frameworks such as Rerun, Three.js, WebGL.
  3. Experience with OpenCV, PyTorch or Tensorflow


Personal skills:

  • You conduct scientific research in an independent and upright way within a multidisciplinary environment and communicate your results in a clear, concise and precise manner.
  • You take initiative, solve problems autonomously and find alternatives or solutions.
  • You are flexible for change and adapt yourself.
  • You commit yourself in your job by giving the best of your aptitudes in striving toward the highest quality standards and persevere when needed.
  • You will be working very closely together with the industrial partner and will get insight in their proprietary intellectual property. Confidentiality is therefore an absolute must.

Other skills:

  • The applicant shall have good knowledge of English (oral / written).
  • Minimum knowledge of French or Dutch is an added value for collaboration with peers.
  • A driver’s licence (but not necessarily a car) is highly recommended


Specific Requirements

  • The researcher may be exposed to classified information and will therefore have to obtain the required security clearance. The candidate must consent with the background check required to obtain this clearance, which will be executed by Belgian Defense.
  • Only applicants with a nationality of a country that is both part of NATO and the EU will be eligible.
  • Working for the Patrimony requires living in Belgium for the duration of the study.


Application

Please send by email:

  • (in the body of your email) a summary containing
  • Your affinity with the research topic
  • Your academic degree and years of relevant experience
  • how your profile matches the list of “must have” and “nice to have” skills listed above, keeping the same structure/numbering as in this job offer
  • (in attachment) a CV
  • (in attachment) a scan of both sides of your ID card

to ir Charles HAMESSE (Charles.hamesse@mil.be), Prof Dr ir Rob HAELTERMAN (rob.haelterman@mil.be) and to erm-deao-rswo@mil.be

Please mention clearly the reference of the project: “DREAM”.

Application deadline: 16 MAY 25.

The interviews will take place at the Royal Military Academy, Hobbemastraat 8, 1000 Brussels. If needed, on-line interviews can be organized. The date and time of the interview will be communicated to the preselected candidates.


Contract

  • Probable date of recruitment: mid-August, in consultation with the applicant.
  • Status: Full-time employment (38 hours / week) based on an open-ended contract with the Patrimony of the Royal Military Academy (you will not be a civil servant).

If needed:

  • Please note that your contract will be open-ended, but the financing of the contract will be tied to the funding project, which is guaranteed until October 31st, 2027. The financing of your contract beyond that period is therefore not 100% guaranteed. However, the Patrimony has a policy to keep the good elements on board and the research focus of this job offer fits within our core research activities, so there is a high chance that we will be able to offer you follow-up projects beyond that date.
  • Wage scale: class A1 (holder of a Master's degree in Science or equivalent), class A2 (holder of an Ir degree or equivalent Master's in Engineering Sciences, doctor’s degree in the same area of expertise). RMA-Patrimony applies a merit-based research career track, allowing researchers to advance in wage scale based upon annual evaluations.
  • Holiday pay.


Extra legal benefits

  • Possibility to benefit from a bilingualism allowance (Dutch/French) following a SELOR test;
  • End-of-year bonus;
  • Free DKV hospitalization insurance. Possibility of additional affiliation for one or more persons living under the same roof: spouse, child(ren) (50% of the price per additional member);
  • Bike allowance / Free public transport (home-work commute);
  • Meal vouchers (6€ / day);
  • Free access to campus sports facilities outside working hours;
  • On-campus restaurant and cafeteria with democratic prices (discount on the daily menu);
  • Flexible working hours within the 38-hour week;
  • Teleworking possible with allowance (2 days / week max);
  • Holidays:
  • 29 days holiday / year from the 1st year of contract (then from 45 years: +1 day holiday every 5 years)
  • 1 week OFF every year between Christmas and New year’s Eve (independent of the annual balance of holidays).
  • Advantages and interesting offers thanks to the Benefits@work card (discounts, vouchers...);
  • Entitlement to services offered by the ‘Office Central d'Action Sociale et Culturelle de la Défense’ (OCASC): among others holiday centres, discount on travel organised by the tour operator...;
  • Possibility to benefit from the nursery funded by Belgian Defence (subject to availability).


Workplace

Royal Military Academy, Avenue de la Renaissance 30, 1000 Brussels. Occasional travels abroad for scientific conferences, measurement campaigns, etc.

Title: Experienced Data scientist
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

The Tribe Artificial Intelligence aims to deliver an efficient and seamless banking experience for our customers and empower our employees through AI. Our expert team of approximately 90 experts includes Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Business Analysts, Scrum Masters, Product Owners and Managers. We are seeking a Data Scientist with a minimum of 3 years of experience in developing AI applications, including both generative and predictive AI.




AND IN DETAIL

You develop AI applications to address various business challenges, including virtual assistants to enhance client experiences, advanced AI tools to support employee efficiency and creativity, and automation to optimize internal processes.
You use various analytical methods, including large language models (Prompt Engineering, RAG, Fine-tuning), speech-to-text, agentic AI applications, image generation and interpretation, and classical statistical/machine learning techniques. While expertise in all areas is not required, strong proficiency in core technologies and the ability to learn new methods as needed are essential.
You contribute to deploying AI applications in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
You access one of the richest volumes of varied data in the market and apply your skills to it.
You evolve in an environment where innovation and lean processes are praised, straight-forward communication is encouraged, and peers understand the meaning of team up.
You work with a team of colleagues in an Agile organization who are ready to collaborate and to share their experience.




YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES

You hold at least a Master’s degree in a quantitative field like statistics, computer science or engineering, with a focus on natural language processing. A PhD is advantageous. Candidates from other academic backgrounds with strong analytics knowledge are also welcome.
You have a minimum of 3 years' experience in data science, preferably in the financial sector, though less experience may be accepted if your academic achievements are substantial.
You are fluent in English and have a good command of French and/or Dutch.
You are proficient in Python for model building and understand ML engineering fundamentals (e.g., versioning systems) to produce code ready for CI/CD integration.




WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact that the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we are working towards a better future every day.




YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and goals.




OUR OFFER

In addition to your remuneration and benefits (meal vouchers, insurance, holidays), we offer flexible salary options, allowing you to convert part of your salary into personalised benefits (phone use, IT equipment, transport, etc.).




OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.




TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you. Good luck!




Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!
