Requisition ID: 17999

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Rejoignez Novatix, un des leaders en solutions d'Intelligence Artificielle (IA) et de Machine Learning en Suisse Romande, maintenant membre du groupe Ansam. Nous aidons les organisations à tirer parti de l'IA en les accompagnant de la stratégie à la mise en production : conseil, développement de solutions sur mesure, intégration, maintenance et formation. Notre équipe d’expert·e·s passionné·e·s est dédiée à l’innovation continue et à la création de valeur pour nos clients.

Chez ANSAM, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des éléments clés de notre ADN. Nous nous engageons à offrir à chacun·e de nos collaborateur·rice·s l'opportunité de grandir, réussir et se développer, quel que soit leur profil. Nous croyons que la diversité est essentielle à notre succès. Si vous partagez nos valeurs et que vous répondez aux critères du poste, nous vous encourageons à postuler. Nous sommes ouverts à toutes les candidatures, y compris celles nécessitant des adaptations spécifiques.

Résumé du Poste

En tant que Data Scientist, vous serez au cœur de la valorisation des données chez Novatix. Vous travaillerez avec des clients de divers secteurs pour identifier des opportunités à fort impact, concevoir des modèles de Machine Learning et optimiser les processus décisionnels grâce à l’analyse avancée des données.

Si vous aimez transformer des données complexes en insights actionnables et développer des modèles prédictifs performants, nous voulons vous rencontrer !

Opportunités de Formation

Votre succès est notre priorité. Le domaine de la Data Science évolue rapidement, et nous avons conçu un programme de formation on-the-job approfondi pour vous permettre de rester à la pointe des dernières technologies et méthodologies.

Dès votre arrivée, vous bénéficierez d’un parcours de formation dynamique, combinant sessions théoriques, ateliers pratiques et mentorat avec nos expert·e·s en Data Science.

Responsabilités


Analyser et explorer des ensembles de données volumineux pour identifier des opportunités et générer des insights.
Développer et optimiser des modèles de Machine Learning et d’intelligence artificielle en fonction des besoins métier.
Effectuer des analyses statistiques avancées pour aider les clients à prendre des décisions basées sur les données.
Écrire du code robuste et optimisé en Python et SQL pour manipuler et transformer des données efficacement.
Travailler avec des technologies Big Data (Spark, Databricks, Snowflake) pour traiter des jeux de données à grande échelle.
Industrialiser et déployer des modèles de Data Science en production via MLOps et CI/CD.
Collaborer avec les équipes techniques et métier pour aligner les modèles et analyses sur les objectifs business.
Effectuer une veille technologique sur les nouvelles avancées en Data Science et IA.


Qualifications


3+ ans d’expérience en Data Science, Machine Learning et analyse avancée des données.
Expertise en analyse statistique, modélisation et algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique.
Maîtrise de Python et SQL pour la manipulation et l’analyse de données.
Expérience avec des technologies Big Data (Spark, Databricks, Snowflake, Hadoop).
Connaissance des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
Bonne compréhension des pratiques MLOps pour l’industrialisation des modèles IA.
Expérience en ingénierie des données et pipeline de traitement.
Fortes compétences en résolution de problèmes et analyse critique.
Langues : Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais.


Atouts Supplémentaires


Expérience avec les bases de données NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra, ElasticSearch).
Connaissance en traitement du langage naturel (NLP) et IA générative.
Expérience dans des environnements cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Expérience en optimisation de modèles et calcul GPU (TensorFlow, PyTorch, NVIDIA CUDA).


Pourquoi Rejoindre Novatix ?


💰 Un package de rémunération compétitif : Un salaire attractif à la hauteur de votre expertise.
🎓 Des opportunités de formation continue : Développement professionnel et apprentissage des dernières technologies.
🏡 Flexibilité et équilibre vie pro/perso : Télétravail et horaires aménagés.
🌍 Culture d’entreprise forte et inclusive : Une équipe où chaque voix compte et où l’innovation est au cœur des projets.
🚀 Travailler sur des projets IA et Data Science innovants : Contribution à des solutions Data à fort impact.
Show more

  • Maîtrise de Python et SQL pour la manipulation et l’analyse de données.
  • Expérience avec des technologies Big Data (Spark, Databricks, Snowflake, Hadoop).
  • Connaissance des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
  • Bonne compréhension des pratiques MLOps pour l’industrialisation des modèles IA.
  • Expérience en ingénierie des données et pipeline de traitement.
  • Fortes compétences en résolution de problèmes et analyse critique.
  • Langues : Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais.

Atouts Supplémentaires

  • Expérience avec les bases de données NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra, ElasticSearch).
  • Connaissance en traitement du langage naturel (NLP) et IA générative.
  • Expérience dans des environnements cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP).
  • Expérience en optimisation de modèles et calcul GPU (TensorFlow, PyTorch, NVIDIA CUDA).

Pourquoi Rejoindre Novatix ?

  • 💰 Un package de rémunération compétitif : Un salaire attractif à la hauteur de votre expertise.
  • 🎓 Des opportunités de formation continue : Développement professionnel et apprentissage des dernières technologies.
  • 🏡 Flexibilité et équilibre vie pro/perso : Télétravail et horaires aménagés.
  • 🌍 Culture d’entreprise forte et inclusive : Une équipe où chaque voix compte et où l’innovation est au cœur des projets.
  • 🚀 Travailler sur des projets IA et Data Science innovants : Contribution à des solutions Data à fort impact.

Title: ✨ Head of Data Science / Machine Learning (m/w/d) in Zürich, 160.000 - 250.000 CHF / year + corporate benefits ✨
Description:
✨ Head of Data Science / Machine Learning (m/w/d) in Zürich, 160.000 - 250.000 CHF / year + corporate benefits ✨




One of my clients, a company which has surpassed the startup status and currently looking to scale up to 100+ people in the next coming 2 years from currently 50 people, are looking for a Head of Data Science / Machine Learning (m/w/d).




👨‍💻 Your profile:

10+ years of prof. experience within the data Science / machine learning industry
4+ years of professional experience in management (at least 15+ people, spread within different teams)
You will be the driving force behind their data and ML strategy
You will leading talented teams of data scientists and machine learning specialists, guide the development of state-of-the-art models, and work closely with the leadership to turn data into a key business enabler.
Management to handson-experience: 50:50 (more management focus)
Proven track record of scaling up (a) busines(ses) from 20+ people to 40 people (e.g.)




🏢 Mission & About the Company:

Define and lead the data science & ML roadmap across products and departments
Manage, mentor, and grow a high-performing team
Drive innovation with AI/ML technologies, from prototypes to production
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and business teams
Ensure scalability, quality, and ethical use of data and algorithms
Stay ahead of the curve with latest research and best practices




💶 Remuneration: 🎉

Compensation package: 160.000 - 250.000 CHF / year + corporate benefits, e.g. stock options
Holidays: 5 weeks + Christmas season, roughly 29 days per year
Free option of Mac or Windows (always with the highest possible RAM for the heavy AI-tasks)
Flexible working model (Hybrid or On-Site in Zürich)
Dynamic, open-minded and collaborative culture
Exciting tech stack & greenfield projects
Regular team events, wellness perks & further education budget
Modern offices in the heart of Zürich




🔍 Application process:

CV to my E-mail: malik@triotechrec.comk or apply via LinkedIn
Short (video-)call about this role




📱My contact details:

E-mail: malik@triotechrec.com
Tel: +‭46 8 507 802 59‬




I am looking forward to hearing from you and your application. Reach out or send me a contact request if you have any questions!

Title: Data Scientist, Audio & Speech
Description:
Data Scientist, Speech & Audio

Join the mission to make communications trustworthy in the age of AI




About Us:




Aurigin.ai is a Zurich-born startup on a mission to restore trust in digital communication by protecting high stakes organizations from AI-generated voice fraud in real-time. Banks, Government agencies, and enterprises use our deepfake-detection to stop account take-overs, CEO impersonations and fake news before they cause damage.

We're a team of passionate innovators, coming from top tier tech and consulting firms as well as startups. We thrive on collaboration, embrace a "move fast to launch and iterate" mentality, and are united by a shared vision of a safer, more transparent world in the age of AI.




Why we need you: 




Our real-time deepfake-detection engine is already used by first high-stakes clients, and we’re now accelerating its reach and capabilities. That leap demands a data scientist who can turn terabytes of noisy, real-world audio into fast, reliable deepfake defenses. Your skill in building robust pipelines, experimenting with state-of-the-art models, and translating research into production will keep us ahead of increasingly sophisticated voice fraud. That’s how we can make the world a safer place for banks, governments, and millions of people who rely on trusted communication.




What you will do:




Handle audio data at scale: Design and implement robust data pipelines and feature-extraction modules for large-scale audio datasets
Bring models to life: Prototype, evaluate, and iterate on machine learning models for deepfake detection and language-related tasks
Turn noise into knowledge: Apply data-wrangling and feature-engineering techniques to transform raw audio into ML-ready formats
Measure what matters: Define performance metrics, design experiments, tune hyperparameters, and validate models using rigorous statistical methods
Stay ahead of the curve: Keep up with the latest AI trends and technologies.




About you:




Experience: 2-5 years in data science or machine learning, with a focus on audio signal processing
Technical proficiency: Python, PyTorch, and Hugging Face tools, with familiarity in audio processing libraries (e.g., librosa, torchaudio)
Sound expertise: Strong grasp of audio engineering principles and best practices in feature engineering
Ownership mindset: Self-driven, love solving complex problems, and can run projects end-to-end in a fast-paced startup world.
Be a good human: Contribute to a positive and fun team environment.
Languages: Fluent in English. Any other language is a plus.




Nice-to-have:




Experience with Hugging Face audio models, including fine-tuning for classification or sequence modeling
Knowledge of audio deepfake detection, voice conversion, or speech synthesis
Contributions to open-source ML/audio projects
Real-time audio or streaming data experience




Benefits:




Make a real impact: Join a company that is working with cutting-edge AI technologies and fighting the good fight.
Be part of something big: Help protect the world from AI-generated chaos and shape our product and culture from the beginning.
Work with cool people: Our team is smart, passionate, and driven.
Flexibility: Work from wherever you're most productive and collaborative. (At least two days a week in the office in Zurich)
Competitive salary and sharing the value you help create: We're offering a meaningful ownership stake in the company. CHF ~80k salary + ~CHF 20k in stock options (depending on role and experience)




If you're ready to use your skills for good and want to be part of a team from the start that's making a real difference, we want to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Risorse Professional, realtà specializzata nella Ricerca e Selezione di profili Middle e Senior Management, per storica azienda Cliente, con sede in Svizzera, che opera nel settore degli operatori marittimi/ logistici e che gestisce una moderna flotta di oltre 100 navi, offrendo soluzioni logistiche innovative efficienti e sostenibili su scala globale, ricerca una figura di:




Senior Data Scientist

in grado di trasformare i dati in informazioni utili per supportare decisioni strategiche. La figura ideale ha competenze avanzate in analisi dati, machine learning, visualizzazione e strumenti ETL, con una chiara comprensione del contesto di business.




Requisiti

Esperienza come Data Scientist o ruoli simili in ambito analitico.
Esperienza nel settore dello shipping, marittimo o logistico (preferenziale).
Ottima conoscenza dei linguaggi per l’analisi dati e il machine learning: Python, SQL, R.
Familiarità con strumenti di ETL (Extract, Transform, Load).
Ottima padronanza di Power BI per la visualizzazione e la presentazione dei dati.
Capacità di analizzare, interpretare e modellare grandi set di dati.
Forte orientamento al business: comprensione del significato e del contesto dei dati aziendali.
Ottime capacità comunicative e di presentazione dei risultati.
Conoscenza dell’inglese, sia scritto che parlato.
Costituisce titolo preferenziale l’esperienza nel settore dello shipping, marittimo o logistico, in modo da comprendere rapidamente il significato operativo e commerciale dei dati.




Attività

Analizzare grandi quantità di dati provenienti da diverse fonti aziendali.
Sviluppare modelli predittivi e algoritmi di machine learning per supportare le attività operative e strategiche.
Collaborare con i dipartimenti interni per comprendere le esigenze e trasformarle in soluzioni data-driven.
Estrarre, trasformare e caricare i dati da fonti interne ed esterne.
Produrre dashboard e report interattivi in Power BI per la visualizzazione dei risultati.
Assicurare la qualità, coerenza e integrità dei dati analizzati.
Comunicare insight e raccomandazioni in maniera chiara ai team decisionali.




Altre Informazioni

Sede di lavoro: Lugano, Svizzera.
Impegno lavorativo: posizione a tempo pieno con presenza al 100% in sede.
Pacchetto retributivo: salario competitivo, commisurato all'esperienza e alle competenze, con possibilità di bonus aziendali basati sulle performance.
Ambiente professionale: un contesto di lavoro stimolante e dinamico all'interno di un team internazionale.
Crescita e sviluppo: opportunità di sviluppo professionale e formazione continua.

Show more

Title: Research scientist or engineer 80-100% (f/m/d)
Company: Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research WSL
Description:
You are developing tools to assess the impacts of natural hazards on infrastructure in high mountain areas. This includes preparing hazard indication maps in the context of the Speed2Zero project, a joint initiative of the ETH domain. In addition, you will develop a model chain for real-time hazard assessment, which involves predicting runout and impact of snow avalanches potentially reaching high-mountain passes. These works are part of an Italian-Swiss Interreg project. You work closely with the other project partners and communicate scientific results to practitioners.

You have a degree in geosciences, environmental sciences, or engineering, and good experience in programming and data handling. Good communication skills are required to collaborate effectively with team members from diverse backgrounds and to tailor information to varying levels of expertise. You are well organized, motivated to work in an interdisciplinary and international team, and are keen to find solutions to practical problems.

Please send your complete application to Clemens Güdel, Human Resources SLF, by uploading the requested documents through our webpage. Applications via email will not be considered.Nadine Salzmann, phone +41 81 417 0822, or Jürg Schweizer, phone +41 81 417 0164, will be happy to answer any questions or offer further information.

WSL is committed to diversity and inclusion as core values. We actively promote gender equality and foster an open, inclusive work environment.

Title: Machine Learning Evangelist @AI Startup
Description:
Lightly AG is an official ETH and HSG Spin-off in the field of machine learning and computer vision. Its products are used by leading companies in autonomous driving, medical imaging, and visual inspection to curate visual machine learning data.




Lightly consists of a small team of talented developers, researchers, and business developers in Zurich, who all have a massive impact on the business and product. The company is backed by Y-Combinator, Wingman Ventures, and Soma Capital.


Tasks


At Lightly, our mission is to drive the democratization of artificial intelligence through open-source innovation. Our flagship repository, Lightly, is the leading framework for training self-supervised and foundation models.




We believe in a community-driven approach to AI advancement and strive to empower developers and organizations with the tools they need to create transformative AI solutions. Our open-source commitment is central to this mission, fostering collaboration and innovation within the global AI community.




As a Machine Learning Evangelist at Lightly, you will be a key player in our mission to build and nurture a vibrant open-source community. You will engage directly with developers, data scientists, and AI enthusiasts to promote Lightly, create compelling technical content, and contribute to the ongoing development of our platform




Responsibilities:




Community Engagement (20% of time)





Actively participate in community forums, including GitHub, Stack Overflow, and Slack/Discord channels, addressing questions and fostering discussions.


Organize and host virtual meetups, webinars, and other community events to engage and grow our user base.


Develop and manage community programs, such as ambassador or advocate initiatives, to encourage community involvement and contribution.





Content Creation (40% of time)





Generate high-quality technical content, including blog posts, tutorials, screencasts, and conference talks that educate and inspire our community.


Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to produce content that highlights new features, use cases, and best practices.





Product Contribution (40% of time)





Contribute to the development of Lightly, particularly in areas related to community feedback and user experience improvements.


Assist in the creation of product documentation and guides to ensure ease of use for new and existing users.



Requirements


Who we are looking for:





Professional experience in machine learning or data science (2+ years preferred).


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.


Proficiency in Python and familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.


Experience with open-source projects, either as a maintainer or active contributor.


Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to create engaging technical content.


Passion for building and nurturing community relationships and fostering a collaborative environment.





Nice to Have:





Experience with computer vision applications.


Prior experience in a developer advocacy or technical marketing role.


Familiarity with collaborative development tools (e.g., GitHub, Slack).





Important: We believe in people who are driven by curiosity and are willing to learn and take the next step. Please also reach out if you don't exactly "check all these boxes".


Benefits



Competitive salary, depending on experience.


Equity options to share in the success of our company.


Flexible working hours and a remote-friendly work environment.


Comprehensive benefits package, including financial support for sports/health, mobility, and education.


Opportunities for professional growth and development in an innovative and supportive team.


Optional: Office in the heart of Zurich next to the central station with Snacks


Company events, retreats, and offsites





If you're passionate about AI and open source, and you thrive in a community-centric environment, we'd love to hear from you!




Apply Now: Please include your resume, a cover letter, and links to any relevant projects or content you've created.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Bioinformatics & Microbiology)
Description:
About Us:

At Precise Health SA, we are pioneering personalized bacteriophage therapies using AI and microbiology to tackle bacterial infections. Our interdisciplinary team bridges innovative biotechnology solutions with machine learning, creating therapies that are precise, scalable, and impactful.




Role Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team. You will play a critical role at the intersection of bioinformatics and microbiology, translating biological insights into computational models that enhance our platform. This position requires close collaboration with both computational biologists and wet-lab scientists, making an understanding of biological processes and laboratory methodologies essential.




Responsibilities:

Develop, optimize, and deploy machine learning models to analyze genomic and microbiological data.
Integrate bioinformatics pipelines with laboratory processes to ensure seamless translation from computational predictions to experimental validation.
Collaborate closely with microbiologists and bioinformaticians to interpret biological data, refine algorithms, and troubleshoot challenges.
Evaluate and implement emerging ML technologies to maintain our platform's competitive advantage.
Document methodologies, results, and contribute to publications and reports.




Qualifications:

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related discipline.
Demonstrated expertise in machine learning algorithms, model development, and validation, particularly in bioinformatics applications.
Familiarity with genomic data processing tools and microbiological wet-lab processes.
Programming proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to interdisciplinary teams.




Preferred Skills:

Experience with bacteriophage biology or antimicrobial resistance projects.
Hands-on experience in microbiological assays or laboratory methods.
Familiarity with software engineering best practices, version control systems etc




Why Join Us?

Engage in meaningful work that directly impacts patient outcomes.
Be part of a vibrant, interdisciplinary, and collaborative team.
Opportunity to contribute to innovative healthcare solutions in an evolving biotech startup environment.

Application Process: Interested applicants, please submit your resume directly on LinkedIn

At Precise Health SA, we are pioneering personalized bacteriophage therapies using AI and microbiology to tackle bacterial infections. Our interdisciplinary team bridges innovative biotechnology solutions with machine learning, creating therapies that are precise, scalable, and impactful.


Role Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team. You will play a critical role at the intersection of bioinformatics and microbiology, translating biological insights into computational models that enhance our platform. This position requires close collaboration with both computational biologists and wet-lab scientists, making an understanding of biological processes and laboratory methodologies essential.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop, optimize, and deploy machine learning models to analyze genomic and microbiological data.
  • Integrate bioinformatics pipelines with laboratory processes to ensure seamless translation from computational predictions to experimental validation.
  • Collaborate closely with microbiologists and bioinformaticians to interpret biological data, refine algorithms, and troubleshoot challenges.
  • Evaluate and implement emerging ML technologies to maintain our platform's competitive advantage.
  • Document methodologies, results, and contribute to publications and reports.


Qualifications:

  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related discipline.
  • Demonstrated expertise in machine learning algorithms, model development, and validation, particularly in bioinformatics applications.
  • Familiarity with genomic data processing tools and microbiological wet-lab processes.
  • Programming proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to interdisciplinary teams.


Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with bacteriophage biology or antimicrobial resistance projects.
  • Hands-on experience in microbiological assays or laboratory methods.
  • Familiarity with software engineering best practices, version control systems etc


Why Join Us?

  • Engage in meaningful work that directly impacts patient outcomes.
  • Be part of a vibrant, interdisciplinary, and collaborative team.
  • Opportunity to contribute to innovative healthcare solutions in an evolving biotech startup environment.

Application Process: Interested applicants, please submit your resume directly on LinkedIn

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We’re Hiring: Artificial Intelligence Engineer (Remote – Based in Switzerland)

Are you passionate about building intelligent systems that learn, adapt, and drive real-world impact? We’re looking for an experienced Artificial Intelligence Engineer to design and deploy cutting-edge AI solutions—fully remote, based in Switzerland.

Location: Remote (Must be based in Switzerland)




What You’ll Do

• Design, develop, and implement machine learning models and AI systems

• Work with large datasets to train, evaluate, and fine-tune models

• Collaborate with product and engineering teams to integrate AI into production workflows

• Conduct research and experiment with new algorithms and tools

• Optimize model performance, scalability, and deployment pipelines

• Stay up to date with industry trends and advances in AI/ML




What We’re Looking For

• 3+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or data science

• Strong background in Python and libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or similar

• Experience with data preprocessing, model deployment, and MLOps

• Knowledge of deep learning, NLP, computer vision, or recommendation systems

• Solid understanding of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure)

• Fluent in English; German or French is a plus

• Based in Switzerland and authorized to work remotely




Why Join Us

• 100% remote with flexible hours

• High-impact role on innovative, data-driven products

• Work with an international team at the forefront of AI development

• Culture of curiosity, autonomy, and continuous learning

If you're excited about pushing the boundaries of what machines can do—we want to hear from you.

#AIEngineer #ArtificialIntelligence #RemoteJobs #SwitzerlandJobs #HiringNow #MachineLearning #DeepLearning #NLP #WorkFromHome #TechCareers

Title: MLOps Engineer (80-100%)
Description:
Oops! Unser MLOps braucht Verstärkung.



Die SVA Zürich betreut Hunderttausende von Kundinnen und Kunden – und es werden immer mehr. Um den steigenden Erwartungen an Effizienz und Servicequalität gerecht zu werden, entwickeln wir unser Unternehmen kontinuierlich weiter. Eine zentrale Rolle spielen dabei die Automatisierung und die intelligente Verarbeitung der rasant wachsenden Datenmengen. Mittendrin: Sie als unsere neue Fachperson MLOps.



Wir haben spannende Projekte in der Datenpipeline.



Bei Der SVA Zürich Gibt Es Im Bereich Daten Und KI Noch Viel Zu Tun. Eine Kompetente Und Initiative Persönlichkeit Wie Sie Hat Darum Viel Gestaltungsspielraum. Einige Beispiele




Sie implementieren Best Practices für CI/CD von ML-Modellen (Versionskontrolle, Containerisierung, automatisiertes Testing, Deployment).
Sie entwickeln und optimieren ETL/ELT-Pipelines zur Integration verschiedener Datenquellen ins zentrale Data Warehouse (Exasol).
In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Data Scientists und Data Engineers aus der Unternehmensentwicklung stellen Sie Daten für Modelle und Analysen bereit.
Mit internen und externen Partnern konzipieren und optimieren Sie unsere IT-Infrastruktur (Cloud/On-Premise, Skalierung, Sicherheit).




Ihre Parameter überzeugen uns.



Sie verfügen über




ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in einem technischen oder mathematischen Fach
Programmiererfahrung in Python, Java oder Scala – insbesondere im Zusammenhang mit Datenpipelines und der Verarbeitung unstrukturierter Daten
fundierte SQL-Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit Data-Warehouse-Technologien
Erfahrung mit modernen DevOps-/MLOps-Werkzeugen sowie mit Cloud-Plattformen wie z.B. Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, MLflow.




Wenn Sie ausserdem mit Datenschutz und Datensicherheit vertraut sind – idealerweise im regulierten Umfeld von Sozial- oder Versicherungsinstitutionen –, dann sollten wir uns kennenlernen.





Weitere Auskünfte



Die SVA Zürich ist das Kompetenzzentrum für Sozialversicherungen. Sie gehört zu den Top-Arbeitgebenden im Kanton und liegt in Fussdistanz zum Hauptbahnhof Zürich. Dass unsere mehr als 1000 Mitarbeitenden überdurchschnittlich zufrieden sind, hat gute Gründe: eine Tätigkeit, die Sinn macht, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice und gute Sozialleistungen. Möchten Sie sich in einer wertschätzenden und offenen Unternehmenskultur einbringen und weiterentwickeln? Herzlich willkommen bei der SVA Zürich.



Sie kennen die SVA Zürich nicht? Höchste Zeit, uns kennenzulernen: http://www.svazurich.ch/erleben



Unsere HR-Fachfrau, Edith Steuble, 044 448 58 43, gibt Ihnen gerne weitere Auskünfte.
Show more

Title: Fellow: Software Engineer (Machine Learning)
Description:
Organizational Context




This Fellowship is in the Advanced Technology Applications Center (ATAC) of the Global Databases Division, Infrastructure & Platforms Sector of WIPO. The Section is responsible for providing support in AI and machine learning (ML) applications to other WIPO sections and other external entities. The Section has developed its own AI tools for WIPO, Intellectual Property offices in the countries and for other international organizations: automatic translation tool (WIPO Translate, http://patentscope.wipo.int/translate), image classification and similarity for trademarks and industrial designs (https://branddb.wipo.int/). The section has also developed WIPO speech- to-text (voice recognition for conferences, available at webcast.wipo.int) for the needs of the over 150 meetings that WIPO hosts every year. ATAC wishes to continue exploring the applicability of AI/ML to other intellectual property activities.




We are looking for a fellow to contribute to maintain and further develop WIPO speech-to-text (S2T) and participate in the exploration of new tools like Large Language Models to create downstream applications. The selected fellow will also contribute to the further development of near real time S2T (WIPO Live S2T).




This fellowship provides an opportunity for a young professional to gain knowledge and experience in full lifecycle development of AI/ML models, applications, from data collection, to preparation, training, evaluation, and deployment to production. The post is located at WIPO’s headquarters in Geneva.




The fellow works under the supervision of a Machine Learning Researcher of ATAC.







Duties and Responsibilities




The fellow will perform the following principal duties:




(a) Contribute to the continued development of WIPO Live S2T in the end-to-end paradigm. This includes improving the speed and accuracy of the existing tool.




(b) Contribute to further develop existing WIPO S2T. This includes adding new features using state of the art AI/ML algorithms and models.




(c) Take an active role in daily operations of WIPO S2T and WIPO Live S2T. This includes deploying new instances, monitoring running instances, troubleshooting, and other related activities.




(d) Contribute to WIPO S2T adjacent projects such as speech translation, full text search, summarization, text-to-speech, etc.




(e) Refine the existing training datasets by performing quantitative and qualitative analysis. This also includes the refinement of the data preparation pipelines.




(f) Gather and clean training data, and process it in a format that can successfully be used by our tool. Advise the team on ways to enrich our data resources and explore the usage of external resources.




(g) Contribute to the evaluation of speech-to-text tools and isolate test and development data to carefully evaluate the quality of the trained models using automatic metrics.




(h) Research new technologies in AI/machine learning, evaluate their potential, and contribute to advising the ATAC team on possible new application ideas for WIPO’s Global Database Division.




(i) Perform other related tasks as required.







Requirements




Education - Essential

Advanced university degree (MSc) in computer science in the fields of S2T, Natural Language Processing (NLP), AI/ML, or related fields.




Education - Desirable

PhD in computer science in the fields of S2T, NLP, AI/ML, or related fields.




Experience - Essential

Proven software engineering skills, with a focus on collaborative development, code quality, comprehensive documentation and adherence to best software development practices.
At least two years of experience in the field of AI/ML, relevant R&D projects or PhD.




Experience - Desirable

Two years of experience in S2T.
Experience in NLP
Experience with devOps in server environments.




Language - Essential

Excellent (written and spoken) knowledge of English or excellent (written and spoken) knowledge of French and good knowledge of English.




Language - Desirable

Knowledge of any other UN languages will be considered an advantage.




Job-related Competencies - Essential

Proven extensive knowledge of deep learning architectures focused on speech processing, such as RNN and transformer.
Strong software development skills with a focus on collaborative development, code quality, comprehensive documentation and adherence to best software development practices.
Proficiency in Python, bash and/or Java.
Good level of familiarity with Unix/Linux environments.
Self-driven candidate with critical thinking and strong problem-solving skills..
Ability to work independently as well as being part of the team, persistence when facing difficult or technically new challenges.




Job-related Competencies - Desirable

Machine learning techniques such as neural network training, hyperparameter tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, LORA, ablation studies etc.
Neural networks frameworks and APIs: Pytorch, TensorFlow, FastAI, Huggingface.
Experience with S2T toolkits like: Kaldi, ESPNet, wav2vec.
Internet technologies including Lucene (ElasticSearch / Solr), Angular.js, JavaScript, Tomcat, as well as UI design, CSS, HTML, and related technologies.
Experience with LLMs would be a plus.
DevOps: version control systems (SVN, GIT), containerization (Docker) and cloud servers.
Excellent writing skills for technical documentation, administration guides and user guides in English
Scientific publications or significant contributions to open-source projects will be an advantage.
Knowledge of IP information tools, products, and standards.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to maintain effective partnerships and working relations in a multicultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity.







Terms and Conditions




a) Term of fellowship: A fellowship may be granted for a period of up to 12 months with the possibility to renew.




b) Anticipated Start Date: June 15, 2025.




c) Location: WIPO Headquarters, Geneva, Switzerland.




d) Stipend is set in accordance with the level of qualifications and experience of the Fellow (stipend starts from 6,000 CHF monthly and may vary up to maximum 7,000 CHF monthly). Details are available on request.




e) Travel expenses: WIPO shall contribute towards the cost of the fellow’s travel on engagement and separation from service. If necessary, WIPO may aid in obtaining an entry visa to Switzerland. (If applicable)




f) WIPO contributes towards the medical insurance and provides accident insurance coverage during the fellowship.




g) WIPO will request a “carte de légitimation” for the Fellow, which serves as a residence and work permit, from the Permanent Mission of Switzerland to the United Nations Office and to the other international organizations in Geneva. Family members of the Fellow are not eligible for a “carte de legitimation.” (if applicable)




h) Tax and social security: Fellows shall be solely responsible for meeting any taxation and social security obligations that may arise directly or indirectly from their contract with WIPO. (If applicable)




i) Fellows are not staff members of WIPO and the position does not lead to any employment rights and entitlements beyond the terms of the fellowship.







Application Process




All interested candidates should apply through LinkedIn. Since LinkedIn only allows one document upload under 'Resume', ensure your Curriculum Vitae and Motivation Letter are combined into a single file before submitting.




The application deadline is May 15, 2025.




More information about the activities of the Advanced Technology Applications Center (ATAC) is available at https://www.wipo.int/about-ip/en/artificial_intelligence/ip_administration.html.

Title: Data Engineer / Scientist
Description:
CLEEVEN, cabinet de conseil en technologie, s’est construit autour de deux fortes convictions :

L’excellence des ingénieurs européens doit assurer la compétitivité mondiale

Notre mission humaine : accompagner nos collaborateurs dans leur développement personnel.




Dans le cadre d’un projet stratégique mené chez l’un de nos clients suisses nous recrutons en CDI un Consultant Technique Power BI / GCP Looker (H/F) pour accompagner la migration d’un existant Power BI vers l’environnement Google Cloud Platform (Looker), et assurer la maintenance évolutive des dashboards existants.




Rôle et responsabilités :

Analyser l’existant Power BI (dashboards, jeux de données, modèles sémantiques)
Participer à la définition de la nouvelle architecture BI cible dans GCP
Migrer les rapports Power BI vers Looker en assurant la qualité des visualisations et des données
Adapter ou reconstruire les pipelines de données nécessaires (SQL / BigQuery)
Optimiser les performances des rapports et des modèles de données
Maintenir et faire évoluer les rapports Power BI existants durant la phase de transition
Documenter les rapports, modèles et logiques métiers
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes Data, Métiers et IT internes




Compétences attendues :

Très bonne maîtrise de Power BI (modélisation, DAX, visualisations, administration)
Expérience sur Looker appréciée (LookML, développement de rapports, paramétrage de modèles)
Bonne connaissance de l’environnement Google Cloud Platform, notamment BigQuery
Maîtrise du langage SQL pour la transformation et l’exploitation de données
Sensibilité à la qualité de la donnée, la performance et l’UX des dashboards
Une expérience en migration BI (Power BI vers autre solution) est un vrai plus
Connaissance du modèle de données SAP et/ou du secteur industriel est un atout apprécié




Profil recherché :

Formation Bac+5 (ingénieur ou équivalent en informatique/data)
Expérience confirmée (3+ ans) sur Power BI
Une première sur GCP/Looker est un vrai plus
Capacité à évoluer dans des environnements complexes avec plusieurs parties prenantes
Autonomie, esprit d’analyse, force de proposition
Français courant, l'anglais et l'allemand sont un plus
Situation administrative permettant de travailler en Suisse




À très vite,

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Our Computational Sciences group is a team of machine-learning engineers, computational chemists, and drug-discovery scientists. We build in-silico tools that let our Medicinal-Chemistry and Biology colleagues make faster, smarter decisions throughout hit-finding, hit-to-lead, and lead-optimization.

We’re searching for research engineers who love creating algorithms, models, and systems that unlock value in small-molecule drug-discovery workflows and advance the state-of-the-art in ML for chemistry.




Key qualifications:




Hands-on deep-learning expertise with a focus on molecular-representation learning: graph neural networks (GNNs), 3-D transformers, diffusion/flow models, or large language models for chemistry (e.g., SELFIES/SMILES transformers).
Solid technical foundations in mathematics and statistics;
Proficient programming skills in Python and one or more of the ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, and JAX;
Familiarity with MLOps & DevOps (Docker, Git, CI/CD, experiment tracking, cloud computer).
Ability to work in a collaborative environment across different geographical regions;




What you'll do:




We have seen that machine learning methods applied to problems in protein engineering can genuinely be impactful. Furthermore, these in-silico methods can be even more rewarding, when they are put to the test in our lab as part of our drug development programs. You will be working in a team of talented and driven engineers and scientists, who are striving to make a difference in drug development and open to applying novel techniques in order to contribute to our understanding of some of the most relevant areas of protein science.




The role mainly involves:




Design novel ML/AI algorithms for small-molecule tasks e.g., property prediction, binding-affinity estimation, activity cliffs, ADME/Tox, and generative molecule design.
Integrate physics-based methods with data-driven models to build hybrid, end-to-end pipelines.
Build & own our chemistry-focused MLOps stack, taking models from research to robust production services.
Explore blue-sky research directions while balancing near-term program needs.
Collaborate closely with medicinal chemists and biologists, translating model insights into tangible design hypotheses and experimental campaigns.
Communicate results to technical and non-technical stakeholders papers, internal seminars, open-source contributions, and conference talks.




Education & Experience:




PhD (or MS + 2 yrs experience) in Computer Science, Computational Chemistry, Cheminformatics, Chemical Engineering, Applied Physics, or a related field.
Publications, patents, open-source repos, or shipped products demonstrating impact in AI-for-chemistry or computational drug discovery are highly valued.




The role could be either based in Switzerland, the UK or the US.










We inform you that your personal data will be processed according to the applicable Data Protection Law. The Data Controller is Peptone Switzerland AG, which will process your personal data for employee recruitment purposes. To view the extended information notice, please select the 'apply to position' link here above.

Title: Senior Applied Scientist, NLP/ML/GenAI
Description:
Are you excited about working at the forefront of applied research in an industry setting? Thomson Reuters Labs in Toronto is seeking scientists with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art information retrieval, natural language processing and generative AI.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our customers through applied research in informational retrieval, natural language processing and machine learning. We work closely with product and domain experts to identify compelling solutions at the intersection of user needs and technical feasibility. Our team is responsible for designing the next generation of tax, accounting and audit compliance software for Tax Professionals and Corporates in the US, and across the global markets. We own AI innovation for Thomson Reuters’ core tax products, including CoCounsel for Tax, Checkpoint Edge, Cloud Audit Suite, SurePrep and ONESOURCE.

About the Role:

Senior Applied Scientists are experts in Machine Learning / NLP, responsible for the design and delivery of AI solutions that enhance Thomson Reuters' products. They leverage information retrieval techniques, prompting workflows, model training and evaluation design to build and optimize solutions. Their work ensures AI technologies are effectively aligned with business objectives, driving product innovation and value.

As a Senior Applied Scientist, you will:


Own and manage end-to-end model development, guiding others in research, data engineering, and evaluation.
Operate in an agile way, pushing for quick iterations guided by customers’ needs.
Be accountable for all research deliverables on small to medium-sized projects
Communicate research in peer-reviewed publications and develop patentable ideas ensuring competitiveness of the company’s products and services.
Work with stakeholders to define scope, determine feasibility, and translate business/customer objectives into technical requirements.
Partner effectively with Engineering to ensure well-managed software delivery and co-design ML Ops processes related to model monitoring, evaluation, and retraining.



About You:

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Applied Scientist if your background includes:


PhD in a relevant discipline or Master’s plus a comparable level of experience 
5+ years of hands-on experience building IR / NLP systems for commercial applications 
Experience writing production code and ensuring well-managed software delivery 
Demonstrable experience translating complex problems into successful AI applications
Outstanding communication, problem-solving, and analysis skills 
Collaborating with Product, Engineering and Business Stakeholders in an agile manner to demonstrate value and iterate with customer feedback
(Preferred) Publications at relevant venues such as ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGIR, or KDD.



What’s in it For You?


Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
Industry Competitive Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Culture: Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
Making a Real-World Impact: We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

About Us

Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here.

Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Title: Research Intern for Deep Generative Modeling
Description:
For: Sony AI

Location: Remote, Tokyo

Sony AI's Deep Generative Modeling (DGM) team delves into deep learning fundamentals and their practical applications for integration with Sony's business. We are actively recruiting skilled research scientists or engineers with a robust engineering background to contribute to our endeavors. Joining us offers numerous opportunities to develop cutting-edge, large-scale AI models through internal collaborations. Ideal candidates possess diverse experience in large-scale or cross-modalities (computer vision, NLP, audio, videos etc.) implementations. This Tokyo-based position operates in an English-speaking environment.

Learn More About Sony AI Here

www.linkedin.com/company/sonyai/life

https://ai.sony

Roles And Responsibilities

As a Research Intern, you will conduct novel and advanced research with internal members. You are expected to be self-motivated and have the ability to conduct and implement innovative ideas with internal collaborations. Also, we expect the outcome will be published as academic papers.

Required Qualifications And Skills


Strong technical background in machine learning and deep learning
Experience in developing novel models or algorithms, with a track record of publishing papers at major conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR, etc.).
Excellent analytical and programming skills for large-scale deep learning
Strong communication and presentation skills


Preferred Qualifications


Diverse experience and knowledge in generative models, representation learning or general realm of deep learning
Have some experience in multiple modalities of deep learning, such as computer vision, natural language processing or audio


Location: Remote from Europe or Tokyo-based

Life At Sony Research

Our work environment is diverse and motivated with an innovative open mindset. Sony AI is committed to building a diverse team of people with different characters, stories and skillsets because we know this drives innovation and creativity. Our commitment to nurturing a friendly and supportive place of work where everyone has a sense of belonging and inclusion creates an atmosphere of learning and personal growth. We focus on achieving healthy work-life balance for our teams, supported by hybrid and flexible working.

You will work on exciting projects at the cutting edge of AI that are in the realms of entertainment or for the betterment of society, and you will have access to the most innovative technologies from across the Sony universe and the opportunity to partner with Sony’s leading companies.

When projects are finished, we publish our work, and all our contributors are recognised on research pieces, at top-tier conferences, and in journals. You will also have access to workshops and development programs to expand your knowledge and skills. We want you to drive your career, find your direction and take authorship of your personal story at Sony AI, while enjoying the security and the resource-rich environment that comes with being part of a global corporation that has R&D in its DNA.

Bring Your Uniqueness To Sony

We are passionate about creating a culture that promotes equity and cultivates inclusion, diversity, and belonging. We want employees with diverse backgrounds and perspectives that will stimulate innovation and have a direct impact on our creation of social value to fulfil Sony’s purpose – ‘to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology’. We want you to bring your unique self to work and help shape our culture.

Equal Opportunity

Sony Europe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, or any other protected characteristics.

Disability Accommodation for Applicants to Sony Europe

Sony Europe will provide reasonable accommodation for any qualified individuals with disabilities in the application process. For reasonable accommodation requests, please contact us by email at AccommodationRequest@eu.sony.com or by mail to: Sony Europe B.V, Human Resources Department, the Heights, Brooklands, Surrey, KT13 0XW, UK. When contacting us please indicate the position you are applying for, and the accommodation required.

Title: AI/LLM Engineer
Description:
Our client, a ML Focused consultancy are looking for a German-speaking AI Engineering Consultant to join a fast-growing team in Basel and drive impactful AI transformations! (They also have a several ongoing projects in Zurich)🔥

💡 Why this role?
You’ll be at the forefront of AI & ML adoption, helping organizations design, build & scale ML solutions beyond prototypes. You won’t just write code—you’ll shape AI strategy, implement best practices, and enable teams to unlock the full potential of AI.

🌍 Your impact:
✅ Consult & Engineer: Work with cutting-edge ML, LLMs & Generative AI technologies to solve real-world challenges.
✅ End-to-End AI Operations: Design & optimize data, model & code pipelines (DataOps, MLOps & DevOps).
✅ Technical Leadership: Be a trusted advisor, shape solution blueprints, and drive AI engineering excellence.
✅ Collaboration & Enablement: Work closely with teams to operationalize AI & ensure reliability, scalability, and automation.

🔍 What you bring:
🔹 3+ years of experience in ML, AI, or Software Engineering
🔹 Hands-on expertise in ML models, LLMs, and Data/AI platforms (Snowflake, Databricks, etc.)
🔹 Strong understanding of DataOps, DevOps, and MLOps best practices
🔹 Passion for scaling AI beyond POCs & driving enterprise AI success

Title: Data Scientist Operations
Description:
Arxada is a global specialty chemicals business that’s committed to solving the world’s toughest preservation challenges through better science. [With a proud history of innovation dating back more than a century], we aim to help our customers develop more sustainable solutions that protect and maintain the health and wellbeing of people and extend the life of vital infrastructure while working to reduce our and our customers’ ecological footprint.

Sustainable preservation is one of our top priorities. We are making significant strategic investments that will not only decrease our own environmental footprint, but also help customers adapt to long-term environmental and social change through the development of cleaner, greener solutions.

The Data Scientist Operations is crucial to optimize production processes and productivity through the application of data analytics and data insights to the production environment – solve business problems through data.

He / she will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, developing predictive models, and implementing AI-driven solutions to enhance operational efficiency and productivity.

The person will work very closely with business operations in order to tell the productivity story through data, and with other IT functions to understand data, application, and infrastructure dependencies.

The person has a strong background in data structures, data analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and operational technology, and he / she is familiar with OSISoft and Seeq solutions.

Key Accountabilities:


Collaborate with commercial, R&D, and process teams to identify pain points and opportunities using customer journey mapping and process analysis.
Propose and implement data-driven solutions, using proof of concept and experimentation when needed.
Analyze complex data sets to uncover trends and generate actionable insights.
Integrate AI and data solutions into OT systems to enhance automation, decision-making, and compliance.
Translate business needs into data strategies and develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations for stakeholders.
Partner with cross-functional teams, vendors, and OEMs to understand and leverage OT and IT data sources.
Apply Agile principles, ensure standardization, documentation, training, and compliance with data and security standards.
Stay current on trends in data analytics, visualization, and OT technologies.


Key Skills & Experience:


Proficient in Python, R, SQL; familiar with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Solid understanding of manufacturing, supply chain, and R&D environments.
Experience with OT infrastructure (e.g., OSIsoft PI, MSSQL, Seeq) and data integration in complex environments.
Skilled in Agile project management and able to work independently or in teams.
Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot issues, manage stakeholders, and drive innovation.
Experience in delivering compliant IT/OT systems in regulated environments.


Arxada has world class offering in two distinct areas:

Microbial Control Solutions (MCS) focuses on threats posed by microorganisms to people and planet through five distinct business lines including Professional Hygiene, Home & Personal Care, Wood Protection, Paints & Coatings and Material Protection.

Nutrition, Care & Environmental (NCE), meanwhile, provides materials used to manufacture composites for electronics, aerospace and other markets, as well as vitamins and nutritional ingredients, chemicals and performance intermediates, and raw materials for a wide range of high-performance applications.

Arxada is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

The person has a strong background in data structures, data analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and operational technology, and he / she is familiar with OSISoft and Seeq solutions.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Collaborate with commercial, R&D, and process teams to identify pain points and opportunities using customer journey mapping and process analysis.
  • Propose and implement data-driven solutions, using proof of concept and experimentation when needed.
  • Analyze complex data sets to uncover trends and generate actionable insights.
  • Integrate AI and data solutions into OT systems to enhance automation, decision-making, and compliance.
  • Translate business needs into data strategies and develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations for stakeholders.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams, vendors, and OEMs to understand and leverage OT and IT data sources.
  • Apply Agile principles, ensure standardization, documentation, training, and compliance with data and security standards.
  • Stay current on trends in data analytics, visualization, and OT technologies.

Key Skills & Experience:

  • Proficient in Python, R, SQL; familiar with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Solid understanding of manufacturing, supply chain, and R&D environments.
  • Experience with OT infrastructure (e.g., OSIsoft PI, MSSQL, Seeq) and data integration in complex environments.
  • Skilled in Agile project management and able to work independently or in teams.
  • Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot issues, manage stakeholders, and drive innovation.
  • Experience in delivering compliant IT/OT systems in regulated environments.

Arxada has world class offering in two distinct areas:

Microbial Control Solutions (MCS) focuses on threats posed by microorganisms to people and planet through five distinct business lines including Professional Hygiene, Home & Personal Care, Wood Protection, Paints & Coatings and Material Protection.

Nutrition, Care & Environmental (NCE), meanwhile, provides materials used to manufacture composites for electronics, aerospace and other markets, as well as vitamins and nutritional ingredients, chemicals and performance intermediates, and raw materials for a wide range of high-performance applications.

Arxada is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

CH15

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being: Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth, Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace, Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays
Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth: Development Dollars, Leadership development, Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
5 weeks paid vacation
Social events & Thursday happy hours
Free lunch 2 days per week
Pension plan contributions
Supplemental accident insurance
Health insurance subsidy of 250 CHF per month
Lunch Check Card of 180 CHF per month
Profawo membership which is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the compatibility of family and work



Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Data Scientist Operations
Description:
Arxada is a global specialty chemicals business that’s committed to solving the world’s toughest preservation challenges through better science. [With a proud history of innovation dating back more than a century], we aim to help our customers develop more sustainable solutions that protect and maintain the health and wellbeing of people and extend the life of vital infrastructure while working to reduce our and our customers’ ecological footprint.

Sustainable preservation is one of our top priorities. We are making significant strategic investments that will not only decrease our own environmental footprint, but also help customers adapt to long-term environmental and social change through the development of cleaner, greener solutions.

The Data Scientist Operations is crucial to optimize production processes and productivity through the application of data analytics and data insights to the production environment – solve business problems through data.

He / she will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, developing predictive models, and implementing AI-driven solutions to enhance operational efficiency and productivity.

The person will work very closely with business operations in order to tell the productivity story through data, and with other IT functions to understand data, application, and infrastructure dependencies.

The person has a strong background in data structures, data analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and operational technology, and he / she is familiar with OSISoft and Seeq solutions.

Key Accountabilities:


Collaborate with commercial, R&D, and process teams to identify pain points and opportunities using customer journey mapping and process analysis.
Propose and implement data-driven solutions, using proof of concept and experimentation when needed.
Analyze complex data sets to uncover trends and generate actionable insights.
Integrate AI and data solutions into OT systems to enhance automation, decision-making, and compliance.
Translate business needs into data strategies and develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations for stakeholders.
Partner with cross-functional teams, vendors, and OEMs to understand and leverage OT and IT data sources.
Apply Agile principles, ensure standardization, documentation, training, and compliance with data and security standards.
Stay current on trends in data analytics, visualization, and OT technologies.


Key Skills & Experience:


Proficient in Python, R, SQL; familiar with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Solid understanding of manufacturing, supply chain, and R&D environments.
Experience with OT infrastructure (e.g., OSIsoft PI, MSSQL, Seeq) and data integration in complex environments.
Skilled in Agile project management and able to work independently or in teams.
Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot issues, manage stakeholders, and drive innovation.
Experience in delivering compliant IT/OT systems in regulated environments.


Arxada has world class offering in two distinct areas:

Microbial Control Solutions (MCS) focuses on threats posed by microorganisms to people and planet through five distinct business lines including Professional Hygiene, Home & Personal Care, Wood Protection, Paints & Coatings and Material Protection.

Nutrition, Care & Environmental (NCE), meanwhile, provides materials used to manufacture composites for electronics, aerospace and other markets, as well as vitamins and nutritional ingredients, chemicals and performance intermediates, and raw materials for a wide range of high-performance applications.

Arxada is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Research Scientist, Paradigms of Intelligence
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
One or more scientific publication submissions for conferences, journals, or public repositories.


Preferred qualifications:


Post-doctoral experience.
Experience with first-authored publications in conferences or journals in physics (e.g., Physical Review Letters), programming languages (e.g., PLDI, ICFP), combinatorial optimization, or especially machine learning (e.g., ICLR, ICML, NeurIPS).
Experience with Machine Learning.
Excellent computer programming skills.
Demonstrated expertise relevant to our mission: programming languages theory (e.g., rewriting systems, type systems, functional programming) or physics of complex systems.


About the jobAs an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

The team you'll be joining aims to advance the field of artificial intelligence by exploring alternative computational paradigms beyond those currently trending. We aim to deepen our understanding of how complexity emerges in differentiable/non-differentiable automated algorithm discovery methods. We are interested in the design of systems that, starting from a problem description, are capable of producing algorithmic solutions that exhibit compositionality, hierarchical structures, and component reuse.

Responsibilities


Carry out sustained exploratory research.
Review literature, identify key questions, design experiments, and interpret results.
Collaborate in person and remotely; maintain a respectful work environment.
Share ideas verbally and in writing; publish and present work at journals and/or scientific conferences.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Senior ML Engineer (Zürich)
Description:
You want to operate at the cutting edge of AI, building the strongest defenses in the AI cybersecurity market. You will be increasing the scope and quality of our defenses, and playing a pivotal role in ensuring that GenAI applications can be deployed securely at scale. You will lead the creation of cutting-edge models that perform exceptionally well and operate in real time. This involves continuously identifying edge cases for our detectors and working to collect and generate intricate threat datasets to improve the performance of these models. You will ensure that Lakera can continuously ship the best defenses in the market with a high cadence. Your passion lies in shaping the future, working on ideas that define the secure use of AI in the decades ahead. Your work will play a vital role in ensuring that AI can unleash its best potential–for good.

About Lakera

Lakera is on a mission to ensure AI does what we want it to do. We are heading towards a future where AI agents run our businesses and personal lives. Here at Lakera, we're not just dreaming about the future; we're building the security foundation for it. We empower security teams and builders so that their businesses can adopt AI technologies and unleash the next phase of intelligent computing.

We work with Fortune 500 companies, startups, and foundation model providers to protect them and their users from adversarial misalignment. We are also the company behind Gandalf, the world’s most popular AI security game.

Lakera has offices in San Francisco and Zurich.

We move fast and work with intensity. We act as one team but expect everyone to take substantial ownership and accountability. We prioritize transparency at every level and are committed to always raising the bar in everything we do. We promote diversity of thought as we believe that creates the best outcomes.

Example projects


Extend the scope of one of our detectors to support multiple languages without dropping performance on already supported languages.
Increase the scope where our defenses perform by 100x (e.g., multi-lingual data, code, etc).
Extend modeling and data generation to enable passing additional context to our prompt injection detectors, such as the LLM output and behavioral metadata.
Red team our model to understand the most pressing vulnerabilities of our detectors and prioritize the data collection and generation required to fix them.


What You’ll Bring


You have at least 4 years of experience shipping machine learning models to production, ideally in environments where reliability and quality are key (e.g., autonomous driving, industrial applications, healthcare).
Most of your experience productionizing ML models has been in unstructured data spaces such as NLP and vision.
You have had experience working on end-to-end development of ML models.
You have experience working on the “long tail” of data distribution, bringing models from prototypes to real-world systems.
You aspire to play a pivotal role in defining the future of secure AI within a mission-driven company with ambitious goals.


👉 Let's stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter & Instagram to learn more about what is happening at Lakera.

ℹ️ Join us on Momentum, the slack community for AI Safety and Security everything.

❗To remove your information from our recruitment database, please email privacy@lakera.ai.
