Title: Trainee Meteorology & Data Science
Description:
Workload: 80-100%

Are you interested to get started in the evolving energy industry?⚡Do you want to explore and learn how meteorology and climate shape the energy markets?

Become part of the Axpo Trainee community! Collaborate with various divisions and gain exciting and in-depth insights into the world of energy. You work in three different teams and build up your network among the whole group.

The perfect start for your future career as a meteorologist! 💯 The traineeship begins on 1st of October 2025 and is limited to 18 months with the option of a permanent position.

What you will do:


Work on different operational and strategic tasks in your assignments and take on responsibility for ongoing projects from day one
Support the meteorology desk 🌧️ in your first assignment with the daily forecasting tasks by compiling and analysing meteorological data for operational reports, with a particular interest in dynamics that are critical to your stakeholders
Develop projects to bring insightful quantifications and visualisations on the weather and climate evolution to drive decision-making in different areas of the company
Perform data analysis with reanalysis data and numerical weather model data in order to improve medium to extended range forecasting capabilities of the meteorology desk of Axpo
Utilize programming languages such as Python to analyse meteorological data and build operational forecasting tools
Assist in identifying patterns and trends in the data relevant to energy forecasting
An international component will be part of your traineeship during the second assignment. Our team in Oslo 🌎 is looking forward to welcoming you



What you bring & who you are:


Master’s degree 🎓 in Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, or a related field (no more than 2 years of post-graduation professional experience)
Good understanding of atmospheric dynamics, knowledge of scientific literature about subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) predictability is a plus
Strong interest in meteorology and its applications in the energy markets
Strong coding skills in either Python, R or Matlab machine learning methods for weather data analysis.
Experience in analysing meteorological datasets, such as reanalysis data, satellite data or numerical weather prediction model data. Experience in hydrology / hydrological modelling is a plus
First work experience as an intern or working student
Great communication skills and high degree of initiative and flexibility
Fluency in English and German, further languages are a plus



About the team:

You will become part of the 18th trainee generation. Meet regularly for several events, whether it’s lunch or even power plant visits. Take advantage from our internal learning platforms, courses, and other opportunities to shape your skills and expand your network.

The Meteorology team at Axpo is fast moving and innovative, trying to convey probabilistic and statistical views on the future weather developments in Europe and the rest of the World. We collaborate broadly with many groups within the company and carry Axpo’s exposure to weather on multiple facets of our operations.

You will work in the office in Baden, with the flexibility to work from home as well. The fixed traineeship salary is CHF 86’000 per year, including several attractive fringe benefits.

Find more details to the traineeship here.

Workload: 80-100%

Are you interested to get started in the evolving energy industry?⚡Do you want to explore and learn how meteorology and climate shape the energy markets?

Become part of the Axpo Trainee community! Collaborate with various divisions and gain exciting and in-depth insights into the world of energy. You work in three different teams and build up your network among the whole group.

The perfect start for your future career as a meteorologist! 💯 The traineeship begins on 1st of October 2025 and is limited to 18 months with the option of a permanent position.

What you will do:

  • Great communication skills and high degree of initiative and flexibility
  • Fluency in English and German, further languages are a plus


About the team:

You will become part of the 18th trainee generation. Meet regularly for several events, whether it’s lunch or even power plant visits. Take advantage from our internal learning platforms, courses, and other opportunities to shape your skills and expand your network.

The Meteorology team at Axpo is fast moving and innovative, trying to convey probabilistic and statistical views on the future weather developments in Europe and the rest of the World. We collaborate broadly with many groups within the company and carry Axpo’s exposure to weather on multiple facets of our operations.

You will work in the office in Baden, with the flexibility to work from home as well. The fixed traineeship salary is CHF 86’000 per year, including several attractive fringe benefits.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
On behalf of our client Hilo by Aktiia, and as part of an exclusive mandate, we are seeking a versatile and motivated individual to join their pioneering team as a




MACHINE LEARING ENGINEER 100%




Company Overview

Hilo by Aktiia believes, the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

They are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. They have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Their technology is based on 18 years of research by their founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.







Responsibilities

Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems




Your profile

M.Sc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques, ideally in a highly regulated field (medtech, banking, …)
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Experience in performing verification and validation (V&V) activities of developed models
Experience in deploying machine learning models in a production environment
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.) + AWS
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Highly organized and meticulous in code development and documentation, ensuring thorough traceability and clarity in compliance with medical device industry standards
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit




Benefits

Pension
Competitive compensation package based on experience
Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule)







Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches?




Then Flurin Schwager looks forward to receiving your application documents or your call.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Computer Vision)
Description:
About the job


Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.Our newest product, ShelfView, is a machine learning-powered platform for retail that enables real time shelf visibility and empowers more intelligent and efficient store operations. With our scalable smart data capture technology via fixed cameras and mobile devices, retailers are on track to save tens of millions in operating expense and in turn generate tens of million more in value for their customers.We are looking for a new colleague to join the ShelfView team and work on creating digital twins of retail shelves. You will be responsible for evolving our current product by adding new features and optimizing the existing offering. You will work on computer vision and deep learning algorithms to improve shelf recognition beyond state of the art.If these challenges sound interesting to you, we’d love to hear from you!




What you will do





Driving and solving fine grained product recognition on retail shelves for our customer use cases


Be involved hands on in all phases of end to end quality improvements (defining and tracking metrics, prototyping, testing, integration of existing models, creation of new models, data collection, analysis, debugging)


Stay up to date with the latest research in detection, segmentation and long tailed object recognition


Set direction and identify opportunities to push boundaries of recognition


Mentoring team members on code quality and engineering practices



Who you are


You are an experienced ML engineer who is passionate about building, shipping, and improving machine learning-powered systems. You have a proven track record of delivering state-of-the-art computer vision systems with a cloud component and firsthand experience bringing them from the prototyping stage to production.




You recognize that software development encompasses both technology and human interaction and feel comfortable working independently or on a team. While you stay on top of the state-of-the-art in CV/ML, you value proven technologies and small increments. You are creative and determined to solve real-world problems by thinking outside the box and making an impact. You thrive on tackling open problems, taking ownership, and effectively overcoming obstacles. You pay attention to details and at the same time are able to take pragmatic shortcuts to reach our goals.




In particular, we are excited to hear from you if the following sounds like you:





7+ years of experience solving recognition problems in the industry with a proven track record of launched products


Fluency in Python and another language (e.g. C/C++, Go or Rust)


Experience with relevant machine learning frameworks (Pytorch, Jax, Tensorflow)


Have firsthand experience with cloud-based development (databases, service-oriented architecture, data pipelines)


Skilled in software design, problem-solving, and debugging


Experience in building visual search systems or a retrieval-augmented LLM systems is a plus



Our tech stack



Python 3.11, Pytorch, Django


MySQL and PostgreSQL


AWS, Kubernetes, GitLab CI






What we offer


Here are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their career at Scandit:





We are certified as a “Great Place to Work” in 10 countries!


Opportunity to work with world-class sales leaders and SaaS experts


Smart, people-first culture


An attractive individual equity plan in a high growth company 


Flexible, office, hybrid or home working


Innovation hackathons for all - not just the techies


Team outings 


Festive/end of year all company celebrations 


Your birthday off 


Learning and development opportunities


Top notch tech pack to enable you to do your most productive work


Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo


As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining





Who we are




Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.




Scandit’s mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit’s technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.




Many of the world’s most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit’s enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.




Scandit was founded by a group of researchers from ETH Zurich and MIT. The company is headquartered in Zurich and is also represented in Boston, London, Warsaw, Tokyo and Tampere. Over the years, our company has evolved into a world-class team of mobile image processing, cloud-computing and “Internet of Things” experts from around the globe and has most recently also opened an office in Tampere, Finland.




“Everybody is welcome here” - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.







#engineering

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
At Akkodis Switzerland, we're looking for a skilled MLOps Engineer to join our team and play a key role in shaping and supporting cutting-edge AI infrastructure. You’ll work across architecture, security, automation, and FinOps—driving smart, reliable solutions from design to deployment.




🚀 What You’ll Be Doing

As a Technical Operations Specialist to support MLOps , you will:

Lead security assessments and ensure policy compliance.
Optimize and monitor cloud infrastructure costs (FinOps).
Support MLOps architecture and contribute to system design and documentation.
Conduct PoCs and evaluate new technologies.
Break down technical tasks and support project planning.




🛠️ What You Bring

Solid experience with cloud platforms (ideally AWS) and cost optimization strategies.
Strong proficiency in Python, plus hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD tools like GitLab and ArgoCD.
Familiarity with security concepts (Zero Trust, SAML, OAuth).
Experience with monitoring/observability tools like Grafana, ELK, or Datadog.
Experience with MLOps tools like Kubeflow or KServe is a plus




💡 Why Join Us?

At Akkodis, you'll collaborate with forward-thinking engineers, data scientists, and architects on impactful AI initiatives. We offer a dynamic environment where your ideas matter, and your growth is supported.
Ready to make an impact at the intersection of AI and infrastructure?
Let’s build the future together.

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in Düsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel’s innovation network.

What You´ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in Düsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master’s or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field—for example, a Bachelor’s in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel’s global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.

Title: Ingénieur(e) Python
Description:
📢 Notre mission

Ivy Partners est une société de conseil suisse qui accompagne les entreprises dans leurs défis stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.




Nous avons à cœur d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui favorise leur épanouissement personnel et professionnel. Nous les accompagnons dans leur montée en compétences et leur ouvrons de réelles perspectives d’évolution.




👩‍💻🧑‍💻 En tant que Ingénieur(e) Python chez Ivy Partners, vous serez amené(e) à :

Concevoir, construire, exploiter et améliorer continuellement les plateformes d'hébergement.
Assurer la sécurité, la mise à jour et le fonctionnement continu des infrastructures.
Participer aux astreintes en rotation avec les autres membres de l'équipe.
Développer des API internes, des outils et des processus qui améliorent l'efficacité et réduisent les risques opérationnels.
Promouvoir les pratiques de développement logiciel et DevOps.
Enseigner, encadrer, développer et conseiller d'autres experts et équipes dans l'organisation.




🏅 À propos de vous:

Vous avez un minimum de 3 ans d'expérience.
Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'ingénieur ou équivalent.
Vous possédez des connaissances approfondies sur des sujets d'architecture tels que l'intégration, la sécurité, le réseau et la gestion des identités et des accès.
Vous maîtrisez les pratiques de l'artisanat logiciel, la programmation et les langages de script (Python, Java, Go, bash, PowerShell, ou équivalents).
Vous avez une solide expérience avec l'intégration continue et la livraison continue.
Vous avez de l'expérience avec les outils de gestion des infrastructures (surveillance et observabilité, journalisation, gestion de configuration, etc.).
Vous êtes un joueur d'équipe avec de fortes compétences en communication et interpersonnelles.
Vous êtes profondément curieux(se) et désireux(se) d'apprendre de nouvelles technologies et compétences.
Vous vous concentrez sur des stratégies proactives pour prévenir les problèmes avant qu'ils ne surviennent.
Vous parlez couramment français et anglais.







🤝 Pourquoi rejoindre Ivy Partners ?




Prendre soin de nos collaborateurs | Nous leur offrons un environnement bienveillant où chacun est valorisé, avec des formations et des opportunités d’évolution en Suisse et à l’international.




Créer un climat de confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est construire une relation basée sur la transparence, le professionnalisme et l’engagement.




Encourager l’innovation | Nous allions technologie et créativité pour mener à bien des transformations numériques à fort impact.




Assumer nos responsabilités | Le collectif est au cœur de nos actions et nous mettons tout en œuvre pour générer un impact positif.

Show more
HTML:
📢 Notre mission

Ivy Partners est une société de conseil suisse qui accompagne les entreprises dans leurs défis stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.


Nous avons à cœur d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui favorise leur épanouissement personnel et professionnel. Nous les accompagnons dans leur montée en compétences et leur ouvrons de réelles perspectives d’évolution.


👩‍💻🧑‍💻 En tant que Ingénieur(e) Python chez Ivy Partners, vous serez amené(e) à :

  • Concevoir, construire, exploiter et améliorer continuellement les plateformes d'hébergement.
  • Assurer la sécurité, la mise à jour et le fonctionnement continu des infrastructures.
  • Participer aux astreintes en rotation avec les autres membres de l'équipe.
  • Développer des API internes, des outils et des processus qui améliorent l'efficacité et réduisent les risques opérationnels.
  • Promouvoir les pratiques de développement logiciel et DevOps.
  • Enseigner, encadrer, développer et conseiller d'autres experts et équipes dans l'organisation.


🏅 À propos de vous:

  • Vous avez un minimum de 3 ans d'expérience.
  • Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'ingénieur ou équivalent.
  • Vous possédez des connaissances approfondies sur des sujets d'architecture tels que l'intégration, la sécurité, le réseau et la gestion des identités et des accès.
  • Vous maîtrisez les pratiques de l'artisanat logiciel, la programmation et les langages de script (Python, Java, Go, bash, PowerShell, ou équivalents).
  • Vous avez une solide expérience avec l'intégration continue et la livraison continue.
  • Vous avez de l'expérience avec les outils de gestion des infrastructures (surveillance et observabilité, journalisation, gestion de configuration, etc.).
  • Vous êtes un joueur d'équipe avec de fortes compétences en communication et interpersonnelles.
  • Vous êtes profondément curieux(se) et désireux(se) d'apprendre de nouvelles technologies et compétences.
  • Vous vous concentrez sur des stratégies proactives pour prévenir les problèmes avant qu'ils ne surviennent.
  • Vous parlez couramment français et anglais.



🤝 Pourquoi rejoindre Ivy Partners ?


Prendre soin de nos collaborateurs | Nous leur offrons un environnement bienveillant où chacun est valorisé, avec des formations et des opportunités d’évolution en Suisse et à l’international.


Créer un climat de confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est construire une relation basée sur la transparence, le professionnalisme et l’engagement.


Encourager l’innovation | Nous allions technologie et créativité pour mener à bien des transformations numériques à fort impact.


Assumer nos responsabilités | Le collectif est au cœur de nos actions et nous mettons tout en œuvre pour générer un impact positif.

Title: Head of Data Science & Modeling R&D (f/m/d) 80-100%
Description:
Switzerland, Basel

Switzerland, Visp

Location, Visp.

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across five continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

The role's purpose and scope are to Lead the SM data science and modeling strategy/ roadmap across the business platform to generate unique insights from data and develop new differentiated offerings using modeling tools. The incumbent will lead a team of expert data scientists/engineers, programmers and modeling experts (AI, mechanistic, statistical) deployed across multiple projects to enable the deployment of industry-leading data science and modeling capabilities.

What You’ll Get


An agile career and dynamic working culture in a growing environment.
An inclusive and ethical workplace.
Compensation programs that recognize high performance.
A variety of competitive benefits.


What You’ll Do


Act as strategic lead for data science and modeling across the organization (R&D, MSAT, dev services, etc) and partner with relevant leads in other Business platforms.
Effectively manage resources and projects in line with prioritized business needs.
Support all business areas (chemistry, bio enhancement, oral drug product, drug delivery), functions (R&D, operations, quality, etc) and sites.
Ensure advanced data science and modeling is a key enabler across our innovation pipeline and operations.
Partner with IT Hub and spoke with contacts to ensure aligned strategy and investment.
Ensure effective deployment of data ops/flows and visualization and modeling tools in operations, and services, through simplified workbenches, workflows, and apps as well as training.
Accelerate the adoption of AI/ML as well as statistical and mechanistic modeling in the organization including through partnerships / external collaborations.
Work closely with other SMEs (IT, Automation, analytical, etc) to ensure alignment of project and priorities.


What We’re Looking For


PhD in Science, an equivalent professional qualification or occupational experience in Chemical engineering, statistics, chem-informatics/chemometrics .
Minimum of 10 years of experience leading/managing projects, including technology projects, in a pharmaceutical /CDMO setting .
Solid experience delivering strong value (new offerings, acceleration, etc) through the development and deployment of modeling tools in a pharmaceutical /CDMO environment.
Demonstrated ability to operate in a complex matrix environment.
Proven track record /scientific expertise in the development and deployment of complex modeling tools, programming, electronic lab notebooks, apps,etc
Established collaboration network and external recognition as SME in the field
Ability to operate at multiple levels from strategic planning to site operational deployment in line with broader R&D and BU objectives .
Support own and matrix team resource planning, project management activities and prioritization decisions.
Strong communication skills and capacity to translate technical information into business insights for decision-making process.


Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
At Nestlé Nutrition, our mission is to nurture a Healthier Generation. We aim to achieve this by leading the way in Research and Development of science proven nutrition solutions and by partnering with parents and healthcare professionals around the world. From pre-conception to adulthood, we are widening our reach and opening up new opportunities across the lifelong nutrition journey.

Position Snapshot

Location: Konolfingen (BE), Switzerland

Company: Nestlé Product & Technology Center (NPTC), Science & Technology

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Permanent contract

What We Offer At Nestlé

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way; across different brands, businesses, functions, and regions.

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration A culture of respect, with diversity, equity and inclusion at its core. Learn more here.

A dynamic international environment empowering you to learn, develop and grow.

Don’t hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Research Scientist you will be investigating innovative product / process concepts through applied research and provide scientific contributions to product / process development projects. You will be mainly working in the field of powdered products, leveraging your technical expertise on dry processing of food powders (e.g. spray drying).

A Day in the Life of a Research Scientist


Plan and execute scientific experiments and projects to develop new concepts of potential business importance
Contribute to project work, e.g. through project management, scientific advice, required analyses and technical assistance
Document and communicate results in reports, presentations, NesTMS etc.
Apply, build and maintain knowledge / expertise in the field of powder science & drying technologies; keep up with developments in aligned research fields, scientific and analytical disciplines
Assess, elaborate, transfer methods (traditional, rapid)
Maintain scientific / analytical network; liaise with other R&D units
Represent NPTC Nutrition / Nestlé in field of expertise
Provide leadership, focus and motivational support to laboratory team
Integrate and coach collaborators (e.g. lab technicians, apprentices, master students)
Assist Group Manager in recruiting, integrating, coaching and developing people
Assure Good Laboratory Practice and efficient laboratory operation


What Will Make You Successful


Ph.D. in Food Science, Food Engineering (or a related discipline) or equivalent experience in R&D
Several years of experience in managing R&D projects or activities, preferably in the food industry.
Experince on functional properties of food powders and their characterization
Strong knowledge of drying and powder handling technologies.
Excellent scientific / technical know-how in data analysis and visualization
Good understanding of digital tools for research
Fluent in written and spoken English, German is a plus
Good leadership and people management skills, at ease with frequent scope change
Excellent communication skills


Nestlé is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nestlé Research and Development in Konolfingen near Bern / Switzerland, we develop for Nestlé worldwide, new products, processes and packaging concepts for a broad range of products of our Nutrition, Dairy, Health Science and Coffee businesses. In addition, we also provide technical assistance to our factories.

Title: Member of Technical Staff, AI Post Training
Description:
Help us develop and train the cutting-edge models that are served in Copilot.

 

At Microsoft AI, we are on a mission to develop the most cutting-edge algorithms for post-training large language models (LLMs) and ship those models to millions of users using Copilot every day.  

 

The AI Post-Training team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of post-training the models that we serve in Copilot, including: data collection, building evaluations that are aligned with our product and model capability goals, prototyping new capabilities to make Copilot more powerful, developing new finetuning algorithms to supercharge our models, working with platform and engineering teams to deploy those models, and closing the loop by improving the models with feedback we receive from our users. We work on the bleeding edge and leverage the most powerful pretrained models and algorithms for our needs. We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other and collaborating to create the best models and products. 

 

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of models that will transform the field. We are looking for candidates who: 


Are passionate about shipping models into products that users will love 
Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment 
Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details 
Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies 
Are willing to meaningfully contribute as individuals with multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities


Responsibilities


Develop data collection, evaluation, and finetuning methods for models. 
Design hypotheses and experiment plans for rapidly iterating on model performance. 
Prototype new model features and capabilities and collaborate with engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to make them a reality. 
Collaborate with pretraining and product platform teams to establish good vertical integration and ship models that Copilot users love. 
Embody our culture and values. 


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work OR equivalent experience.
Expertise in the area of Post-Training AI Models and in applying post-training techniques such as DPO, PPO, or RLHF


#Copilot #MicrosoftAI

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Research Engineer, Data (Foundational Research, Machine Learning)
Description:
Are you a curious and open-minded individual with an interest in state-of-the-art machine learning engineering and research? Thomson Reuters Labs is seeking a Data Engineer with a passion for solving challenging machine learning problems in a data-rich, complex and innovative environment.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our product teams through foundational research and development of new products and technologies. The Labs innovate collaboratively across our core segments in Legal, Tax & Accounting, Government, and Reuters News. We undertake a diverse portfolio of projects while investing in long-term research for the future.

As a Research Engineer, you will be part of a diverse global team of experts. We hire worldleading specialists in SWE /Applied ML, as well as Research, to drive the company’s leading internal AI model development, fueled by an unprecedented wealth of data and powered by cutting-edge technical infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to contribute to a data curation & filtering system combining the best of real-world scalable data processing systems combined with the latest insights into what training data leads to the best LLMs. Thomson Reuters Labs is known for consistently delivering successful datadriven Artificial Intelligence solutions in support of high-growth products that serve Thomson Reuters customers in new and exciting ways.

About the Role:

In this opportunity as a Research Engineer - Data, you will:


Innovate: You will work at the very cutting edge of AI Research at an institution with some of the richest data sources in the world. Through your work, you will help us make the best use of this resource, in a dynamic flywheel that connects data collection & annotation with model training and expert evaluation, helping us continuously improve our training data. You will also develop novel performance-driven data sub-selection methods together with the latest training insights from our researchers.
Engineer and Develop: Design, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines to support LLM training and evaluation. You will also help us develop this in a robust and testable way, through careful source control and a solid back-up system for various data versioning methods.
Collaborate: Working on a collaborative global team of engineers and scientists both within Thomson Reuters and our academic partners at world-leading universities. In addition, you will work closely with world experts in the legal domain, which can provide feedback to your work and/or evaluate your outputs or annotate training data.



About You:

You're a fit for the role of Research Engineer - Data, if your background includes:

Required qualifications:


Relevant degree in a technical discipline.
Interest in & experience working with (applied) machine learning, e.g. few-shot learning with out-of-the-box language models, training of smaller NLP classifiers, etc.
Excellent programming, debugging and system design skills.
Excellent communication skills to report and present software designs and findings clearly, both orally and in writing.
Curious and innovative disposition capable of devising novel, well-founded algorithmic solutions to relevant problems.
Self-driven attitude and ability to work with limited supervision.
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra).
Experience with data pipeline orchestration tools.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure (e.g., S3, BigQuery, Azure Data Lake Storage).
Comfortable working in fast-paced, agile environments, managing uncertainty and ambiguity.



Preferred qualifications:


Additional legal knowledge as evidenced by a degree or interest in the legal domain.
Ability to communicate with multiple stakeholders, including non-technical legal subject matter experts.
Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, or similar.
Experience conducting world-leading research, e.g. by contributions to publications at leading ML venues.
Previous experience working on large-scale data processing systems.
Strong software and/or infrastructure engineering skills, as evidenced by code contributions to popular open-source libraries.



What’s in it For You?


Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
Industry Competitive Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Culture: Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
Making a Real-World Impact: We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

About Us

Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here.

Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Through your work, you will help us make the best use of this resource, in a dynamic flywheel that connects data collection & annotation with model training and expert evaluation, helping us continuously improve our training data. You will also develop novel performance-driven data sub-selection methods together with the latest training insights from our researchers.
  • Engineer and Develop: Design, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines to support LLM training and evaluation. You will also help us develop this in a robust and testable way, through careful source control and a solid back-up system for various data versioning methods.
  • Collaborate: Working on a collaborative global team of engineers and scientists both within Thomson Reuters and our academic partners at world-leading universities. In addition, you will work closely with world experts in the legal domain, which can provide feedback to your work and/or evaluate your outputs or annotate training data.


About You:

You're a fit for the role of Research Engineer - Data, if your background includes:

Required qualifications:

  • Relevant degree in a technical discipline.
  • Interest in & experience working with (applied) machine learning, e.g. few-shot learning with out-of-the-box language models, training of smaller NLP classifiers, etc.
  • Excellent programming, debugging and system design skills.
  • Excellent communication skills to report and present software designs and findings clearly, both orally and in writing.
  • Curious and innovative disposition capable of devising novel, well-founded algorithmic solutions to relevant problems.
  • Self-driven attitude and ability to work with limited supervision.
  • Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra).
  • Experience with data pipeline orchestration tools.
  • Experience with cloud-based data platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure (e.g., S3, BigQuery, Azure Data Lake Storage).
  • Comfortable working in fast-paced, agile environments, managing uncertainty and ambiguity.


Preferred qualifications:

  • Additional legal knowledge as evidenced by a degree or interest in the legal domain.
  • Ability to communicate with multiple stakeholders, including non-technical legal subject matter experts.
  • Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, or similar.
  • Experience conducting world-leading research, e.g. by contributions to publications at leading ML venues.
  • Previous experience working on large-scale data processing systems.
  • Strong software and/or infrastructure engineering skills, as evidenced by code contributions to popular open-source libraries.


What’s in it For You?

  • Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
  • Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
  • Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
  • Industry Competitive Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
  • Culture: Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
  • Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
  • Making a Real-World Impact: We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.


DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

About Us

Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here.

Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Title: MLOps Engineer (80-100%)
Description:
Oops! Unser MLOps braucht Verstärkung.



Die SVA Zürich betreut Hunderttausende von Kundinnen und Kunden – und es werden immer mehr. Um den steigenden Erwartungen an Effizienz und Servicequalität gerecht zu werden, entwickeln wir unser Unternehmen kontinuierlich weiter. Eine zentrale Rolle spielen dabei die Automatisierung und die intelligente Verarbeitung der rasant wachsenden Datenmengen. Mittendrin: Sie als unsere neue Fachperson MLOps.



Wir haben spannende Projekte in der Datenpipeline.



Bei Der SVA Zürich Gibt Es Im Bereich Daten Und KI Noch Viel Zu Tun. Eine Kompetente Und Initiative Persönlichkeit Wie Sie Hat Darum Viel Gestaltungsspielraum. Einige Beispiele




Sie implementieren Best Practices für CI/CD von ML-Modellen (Versionskontrolle, Containerisierung, automatisiertes Testing, Deployment).
Sie entwickeln und optimieren ETL/ELT-Pipelines zur Integration verschiedener Datenquellen ins zentrale Data Warehouse (Exasol).
In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Data Scientists und Data Engineers aus der Unternehmensentwicklung stellen Sie Daten für Modelle und Analysen bereit.
Mit internen und externen Partnern konzipieren und optimieren Sie unsere IT-Infrastruktur (Cloud/On-Premise, Skalierung, Sicherheit).




Ihre Parameter überzeugen uns.



Sie verfügen über




ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in einem technischen oder mathematischen Fach
Programmiererfahrung in Python, Java oder Scala – insbesondere im Zusammenhang mit Datenpipelines und der Verarbeitung unstrukturierter Daten
fundierte SQL-Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit Data-Warehouse-Technologien
Erfahrung mit modernen DevOps-/MLOps-Werkzeugen sowie mit Cloud-Plattformen wie z.B. Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, MLflow.




Wenn Sie ausserdem mit Datenschutz und Datensicherheit vertraut sind – idealerweise im regulierten Umfeld von Sozial- oder Versicherungsinstitutionen –, dann sollten wir uns kennenlernen.





Weitere Auskünfte



Die SVA Zürich ist das Kompetenzzentrum für Sozialversicherungen. Sie gehört zu den Top-Arbeitgebenden im Kanton und liegt in Fussdistanz zum Hauptbahnhof Zürich. Dass unsere mehr als 1000 Mitarbeitenden überdurchschnittlich zufrieden sind, hat gute Gründe: eine Tätigkeit, die Sinn macht, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice und gute Sozialleistungen. Möchten Sie sich in einer wertschätzenden und offenen Unternehmenskultur einbringen und weiterentwickeln? Herzlich willkommen bei der SVA Zürich.



Sie kennen die SVA Zürich nicht? Höchste Zeit, uns kennenzulernen: http://www.svazurich.ch/erleben



Unsere HR-Fachfrau, Edith Steuble, 044 448 58 43, gibt Ihnen gerne weitere Auskünfte.

Title: Fellow: Software Engineer (Machine Learning)
Description:
Organizational Context




This Fellowship is in the Advanced Technology Applications Center (ATAC) of the Global Databases Division, Infrastructure & Platforms Sector of WIPO. The Section is responsible for providing support in AI and machine learning (ML) applications to other WIPO sections and other external entities. The Section has developed its own AI tools for WIPO, Intellectual Property offices in the countries and for other international organizations: automatic translation tool (WIPO Translate, http://patentscope.wipo.int/translate), image classification and similarity for trademarks and industrial designs (https://branddb.wipo.int/). The section has also developed WIPO speech- to-text (voice recognition for conferences, available at webcast.wipo.int) for the needs of the over 150 meetings that WIPO hosts every year. ATAC wishes to continue exploring the applicability of AI/ML to other intellectual property activities.




We are looking for a fellow to contribute to maintain and further develop WIPO speech-to-text (S2T) and participate in the exploration of new tools like Large Language Models to create downstream applications. The selected fellow will also contribute to the further development of near real time S2T (WIPO Live S2T).




This fellowship provides an opportunity for a young professional to gain knowledge and experience in full lifecycle development of AI/ML models, applications, from data collection, to preparation, training, evaluation, and deployment to production. The post is located at WIPO’s headquarters in Geneva.




The fellow works under the supervision of a Machine Learning Researcher of ATAC.







Duties and Responsibilities




The fellow will perform the following principal duties:




(a) Contribute to the continued development of WIPO Live S2T in the end-to-end paradigm. This includes improving the speed and accuracy of the existing tool.




(b) Contribute to further develop existing WIPO S2T. This includes adding new features using state of the art AI/ML algorithms and models.




(c) Take an active role in daily operations of WIPO S2T and WIPO Live S2T. This includes deploying new instances, monitoring running instances, troubleshooting, and other related activities.




(d) Contribute to WIPO S2T adjacent projects such as speech translation, full text search, summarization, text-to-speech, etc.




(e) Refine the existing training datasets by performing quantitative and qualitative analysis. This also includes the refinement of the data preparation pipelines.




(f) Gather and clean training data, and process it in a format that can successfully be used by our tool. Advise the team on ways to enrich our data resources and explore the usage of external resources.




(g) Contribute to the evaluation of speech-to-text tools and isolate test and development data to carefully evaluate the quality of the trained models using automatic metrics.




(h) Research new technologies in AI/machine learning, evaluate their potential, and contribute to advising the ATAC team on possible new application ideas for WIPO’s Global Database Division.




(i) Perform other related tasks as required.







Requirements




Education - Essential

Advanced university degree (MSc) in computer science in the fields of S2T, Natural Language Processing (NLP), AI/ML, or related fields.




Education - Desirable

PhD in computer science in the fields of S2T, NLP, AI/ML, or related fields.




Experience - Essential

Proven software engineering skills, with a focus on collaborative development, code quality, comprehensive documentation and adherence to best software development practices.
At least two years of experience in the field of AI/ML, relevant R&D projects or PhD.




Experience - Desirable

Two years of experience in S2T.
Experience in NLP
Experience with devOps in server environments.




Language - Essential

Excellent (written and spoken) knowledge of English or excellent (written and spoken) knowledge of French and good knowledge of English.




Language - Desirable

Knowledge of any other UN languages will be considered an advantage.




Job-related Competencies - Essential

Proven extensive knowledge of deep learning architectures focused on speech processing, such as RNN and transformer.
Strong software development skills with a focus on collaborative development, code quality, comprehensive documentation and adherence to best software development practices.
Proficiency in Python, bash and/or Java.
Good level of familiarity with Unix/Linux environments.
Self-driven candidate with critical thinking and strong problem-solving skills..
Ability to work independently as well as being part of the team, persistence when facing difficult or technically new challenges.




Job-related Competencies - Desirable

Machine learning techniques such as neural network training, hyperparameter tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, LORA, ablation studies etc.
Neural networks frameworks and APIs: Pytorch, TensorFlow, FastAI, Huggingface.
Experience with S2T toolkits like: Kaldi, ESPNet, wav2vec.
Internet technologies including Lucene (ElasticSearch / Solr), Angular.js, JavaScript, Tomcat, as well as UI design, CSS, HTML, and related technologies.
Experience with LLMs would be a plus.
DevOps: version control systems (SVN, GIT), containerization (Docker) and cloud servers.
Excellent writing skills for technical documentation, administration guides and user guides in English
Scientific publications or significant contributions to open-source projects will be an advantage.
Knowledge of IP information tools, products, and standards.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to maintain effective partnerships and working relations in a multicultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity.







Terms and Conditions




a) Term of fellowship: A fellowship may be granted for a period of up to 12 months with the possibility to renew.




b) Anticipated Start Date: June 15, 2025.




c) Location: WIPO Headquarters, Geneva, Switzerland.




d) Stipend is set in accordance with the level of qualifications and experience of the Fellow (stipend starts from 6,000 CHF monthly and may vary up to maximum 7,000 CHF monthly). Details are available on request.




e) Travel expenses: WIPO shall contribute towards the cost of the fellow’s travel on engagement and separation from service. If necessary, WIPO may aid in obtaining an entry visa to Switzerland. (If applicable)




f) WIPO contributes towards the medical insurance and provides accident insurance coverage during the fellowship.




g) WIPO will request a “carte de légitimation” for the Fellow, which serves as a residence and work permit, from the Permanent Mission of Switzerland to the United Nations Office and to the other international organizations in Geneva. Family members of the Fellow are not eligible for a “carte de legitimation.” (if applicable)




h) Tax and social security: Fellows shall be solely responsible for meeting any taxation and social security obligations that may arise directly or indirectly from their contract with WIPO. (If applicable)




i) Fellows are not staff members of WIPO and the position does not lead to any employment rights and entitlements beyond the terms of the fellowship.







Application Process




All interested candidates should apply through LinkedIn. Since LinkedIn only allows one document upload under 'Resume', ensure your Curriculum Vitae and Motivation Letter are combined into a single file before submitting.




The application deadline is May 15, 2025.




More information about the activities of the Advanced Technology Applications Center (ATAC) is available at https://www.wipo.int/about-ip/en/artificial_intelligence/ip_administration.html.

Title: Data Engineer / Scientist
Description:
CLEEVEN, cabinet de conseil en technologie, s’est construit autour de deux fortes convictions :

L’excellence des ingénieurs européens doit assurer la compétitivité mondiale

Notre mission humaine : accompagner nos collaborateurs dans leur développement personnel.




Dans le cadre d’un projet stratégique mené chez l’un de nos clients suisses nous recrutons en CDI un Consultant Technique Power BI / GCP Looker (H/F) pour accompagner la migration d’un existant Power BI vers l’environnement Google Cloud Platform (Looker), et assurer la maintenance évolutive des dashboards existants.




Rôle et responsabilités :

Analyser l’existant Power BI (dashboards, jeux de données, modèles sémantiques)
Participer à la définition de la nouvelle architecture BI cible dans GCP
Migrer les rapports Power BI vers Looker en assurant la qualité des visualisations et des données
Adapter ou reconstruire les pipelines de données nécessaires (SQL / BigQuery)
Optimiser les performances des rapports et des modèles de données
Maintenir et faire évoluer les rapports Power BI existants durant la phase de transition
Documenter les rapports, modèles et logiques métiers
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes Data, Métiers et IT internes




Compétences attendues :

Très bonne maîtrise de Power BI (modélisation, DAX, visualisations, administration)
Expérience sur Looker appréciée (LookML, développement de rapports, paramétrage de modèles)
Bonne connaissance de l’environnement Google Cloud Platform, notamment BigQuery
Maîtrise du langage SQL pour la transformation et l’exploitation de données
Sensibilité à la qualité de la donnée, la performance et l’UX des dashboards
Une expérience en migration BI (Power BI vers autre solution) est un vrai plus
Connaissance du modèle de données SAP et/ou du secteur industriel est un atout apprécié




Profil recherché :

Formation Bac+5 (ingénieur ou équivalent en informatique/data)
Expérience confirmée (3+ ans) sur Power BI
Une première sur GCP/Looker est un vrai plus
Capacité à évoluer dans des environnements complexes avec plusieurs parties prenantes
Autonomie, esprit d’analyse, force de proposition
Français courant, l'anglais et l'allemand sont un plus
Situation administrative permettant de travailler en Suisse




À très vite,

Show more

  • Une première sur GCP/Looker est un vrai plus
  • Capacité à évoluer dans des environnements complexes avec plusieurs parties prenantes
  • Autonomie, esprit d’analyse, force de proposition
  • Français courant, l'anglais et l'allemand sont un plus
  • Situation administrative permettant de travailler en Suisse


À très vite,

Title: Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Our Computational Sciences group is a team of machine-learning engineers, computational chemists, and drug-discovery scientists. We build in-silico tools that let our Medicinal-Chemistry and Biology colleagues make faster, smarter decisions throughout hit-finding, hit-to-lead, and lead-optimization.

We’re searching for research engineers who love creating algorithms, models, and systems that unlock value in small-molecule drug-discovery workflows and advance the state-of-the-art in ML for chemistry.




Key qualifications:




Hands-on deep-learning expertise with a focus on molecular-representation learning: graph neural networks (GNNs), 3-D transformers, diffusion/flow models, or large language models for chemistry (e.g., SELFIES/SMILES transformers).
Solid technical foundations in mathematics and statistics;
Proficient programming skills in Python and one or more of the ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, and JAX;
Familiarity with MLOps & DevOps (Docker, Git, CI/CD, experiment tracking, cloud computer).
Ability to work in a collaborative environment across different geographical regions;




What you'll do:




We have seen that machine learning methods applied to problems in protein engineering can genuinely be impactful. Furthermore, these in-silico methods can be even more rewarding, when they are put to the test in our lab as part of our drug development programs. You will be working in a team of talented and driven engineers and scientists, who are striving to make a difference in drug development and open to applying novel techniques in order to contribute to our understanding of some of the most relevant areas of protein science.




The role mainly involves:




Design novel ML/AI algorithms for small-molecule tasks e.g., property prediction, binding-affinity estimation, activity cliffs, ADME/Tox, and generative molecule design.
Integrate physics-based methods with data-driven models to build hybrid, end-to-end pipelines.
Build & own our chemistry-focused MLOps stack, taking models from research to robust production services.
Explore blue-sky research directions while balancing near-term program needs.
Collaborate closely with medicinal chemists and biologists, translating model insights into tangible design hypotheses and experimental campaigns.
Communicate results to technical and non-technical stakeholders papers, internal seminars, open-source contributions, and conference talks.




Education & Experience:




PhD (or MS + 2 yrs experience) in Computer Science, Computational Chemistry, Cheminformatics, Chemical Engineering, Applied Physics, or a related field.
Publications, patents, open-source repos, or shipped products demonstrating impact in AI-for-chemistry or computational drug discovery are highly valued.




The role could be either based in Switzerland, the UK or the US.










We inform you that your personal data will be processed according to the applicable Data Protection Law. The Data Controller is Peptone Switzerland AG, which will process your personal data for employee recruitment purposes. To view the extended information notice, please select the 'apply to position' link here above.

Title: Sr. ML/AI Specialist
Description:
Sr. ML/AI Specialist- Revolutionize DeFi with a Growing Protocol | Zug, Switzerland




Are you ready to shape the future of society with your expertise in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence? We are seeking a dynamic and entrepreneurial Sr. ML/AI Specialist to join our fast-growing team in Switzerland. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative projects in the crypto and blockchain sector.




About the Role




As a Sr. ML/AI Specialist, you will conduct deep quantitative analysis to inform capital deployment and investment strategies, as well as support research in risk management, portfolio optimization, and market analysis.

Source, compile, clean, and analyze data across various markets.
Build and develop models to identify trends and patterns.
Implement ML-based approaches for DeFi strategies.
Present findings with effective data visualization.







What Makes You the Ideal Sr. ML/AI Specialist




Minimum 2 years of experience with machine learning and statistical analysis methods.
Strong interest in the cryptocurrency sector, particularly DeFi.
Background in finance or computer/data science with a deep understanding of financial markets.
Proficiency in essential software tools for model implementation; skills in Solidity are a significant asset.







Why You Should Consider This Role - Sr. ML/AI Specialist




Competitive compensation, bonus, and participation opportunities.
Modern working conditions and ample opportunities for personal and professional development.
A supportive team atmosphere with flat hierarchies and a strong entrepreneurial spirit.
Exposure to talented colleagues and clients with unique investment profiles.







If you're self-motivated, disciplined, and detail-oriented, and you thrive in a dynamic environment, apply now for the Sr. ML/AI Specialist position. Be part of a team that adapts traditional portfolio optimization methods to a DeFi yield-focused context and collaborate with a software team to automate data collection and analysis processes.







Take Your Career to the Next Level as a Sr. ML/AI Specialist! Apply Today!

Title: Vision Engineer
Description:
À propos de l'entreprise




Mikron Automation est votre partenaire mondial en solutions d’automatisation avancées. Engagés à fournir les meilleurs systèmes d’assemblage et services tout au long du cycle de vie de vos produits, nous mettons à profit notre savoir-faire en ingénierie, notre expertise en processus complexes, nos plateformes évolutives et notre support durable pour assurer le succès à long terme de nos clients.




À propos du rôle




En tant que Spécialiste en vision industrielle, vous serez impliqué dans la configuration, les tests et l’optimisation des systèmes de vision pour garantir leur conformité aux exigences clients. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l’évaluation de la faisabilité des solutions, la configuration matérielle et logicielle des systèmes, ainsi que dans les interventions techniques en interne et chez les clients.




Responsabilités




Configuration et validation des systèmes

Effectuer les évaluations et essais de faisabilité en réponse aux demandes d’offres.
Configurer les systèmes livrés en fonction des spécifications client, tant au niveau matériel (réglage optique) que logiciel (programmation et paramétrage).
Tester les systèmes pour garantir leur bon fonctionnement conformément au cahier des charges jusqu'à leur acceptation finale (Factory Acceptance Test).
Assurer la réalisation des corrections éventuelles en collaboration avec les services concernés.
Documenter précisément l’état final des systèmes (optique, logiciels, paramètres et configuration).




Suivi et interventions

Garantir l’exécution des activités dans le respect des délais et des coûts définis par le chef de projet.
Intervenir en interne et en externe pour la mise en service, l’acceptation client, les mises à jour, les dépannages et les formations (20-30% de déplacements).




Profil du candidat




Formation et expérience

Diplôme de Technicien ET ou Ingénieur HES en vision industrielle, traitement d’images, robotique ou automation (un atout).
Expérience avec les produits Cognex et/ou Keyence (un avantage).
Connaissances de base d’un langage de programmation orienté objet sous Windows (Microsoft Visual C++, Microsoft Visual Basic ou Microsoft Visual Basic.NET).
Connaissances en architecture PC/Réseau et software temps réel (un plus).




Compétences linguistiques

Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (minimum B2).
Connaissance de l’allemand (un avantage).




Nous vous offrons

L’opportunité de relever des défis variés et d’évoluer au sein d’une société internationale axée sur la satisfaction client et l’innovation technologique.
Un environnement de travail moderne, agile et multiculturel favorisant l’échange de connaissances et le développement personnel et professionnel.
Une gestion de projets centrée sur l’humain et des équipes pluridisciplinaires dynamiques.
Un poste avec des perspectives d’évolution et un accès à la formation continue pour accompagner votre développement.
Un équilibre entre vie privée et vie professionnelle dans une entreprise soucieuse du bien-être de ses collaborateurs.
